translated: In order to refute that, he says, ‚ÄúFire, etc.‚Äù

original: me la sogs ba skyes bus ma byas pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: me la sogs ba skyes bus ma byas pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though fire, etc. are not produced by a person,

original: nyin par bum pa la sogs pa gcig la don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i rgyur pa yin na yang /
analyzed: nyin par bum pa la sogs pa gcig la don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i rgyur pa yin na yang /
translated: they are the causes of true cognition of a pot, etc. during the day, but

original: mtshan mo autpala sngon po la sogs pa thams cad la de ltar de don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan mo autpala sngon po la sogs pa thams cad la de ltar de don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa ma yin gyi /
translated: at night they are not the causes of true cognition of all blue lotuses, etc.

original: 'on kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is also the cause of knowledge that is not in accordance with fact.

original: gal te me la sogs pa ni skyes bu'i bya bas bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te me la sogs pa ni skyes bu'i bya bas bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that fire, etc. are the work of a person because they are produced by human effort,

original: skyes bu'i bya ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i bya ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then they are the work of a person.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te zla ba'i snang ba la sogs pa dag ni skyes bu'i bya ba la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩsgron ma la sogs pa dag skyes bu las skye ba dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang ste sgra dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis don gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na skyes bus ma byas par brjod do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te zla ba'i snang ba la sogs pa dag ni skyes bu'i bya ba la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // sgron ma la sogs pa dag skyes bu las skye ba dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang ste sgra dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis don gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na skyes bus ma byas par brjod do //
translated: That is not so, because the appearance of the moon, etc. do not depend on human effort.üîΩEven if lamps, etc. are produced from a person, like sound, they do not illuminate objects by the power of human desire, and in that case they are said to be not made by a person.

original: de ltar rig byed pa'i sgra rnams kyang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len na yang gnyi gar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rig byed pa'i sgra rnams kyang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len na yang gnyi gar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if you accept that Vedic sounds are not made by a person, they are both.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin dang / don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin dang / don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be the cause of knowledge that is in accordance with fact and of knowledge that is not in accordance with fact.

original: me la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: me la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response is stated in the lines ‚ÄúFire and so on are produced . . .‚Äù

original: me la sogs pa dag ni byas pa nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: me la sogs pa dag ni byas pa nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
translated: Fire and so on are produced by causes, and they are in accordance with conditions.

original: gang gi 'khrul pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i dbang gis gzhan la ste /
analyzed: gang gi 'khrul pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i dbang gis gzhan la ste /
translated: The cause of error is the power of something else.

original: autpala sngon po la sogs pa la rnam pa gzhan nyid yin pa zhes bya ba phyin ci log gi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: autpala sngon po la sogs pa la rnam pa gzhan nyid yin pa zhes bya ba phyin ci log gi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is absurd to say that the cause of erroneous knowledge is something else, such as a blue lotus.

original: sgra rtag pa dag la yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gyi stobs kyis log pa'i shes pa skyed pa de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rtag pa dag la yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gyi stobs kyis log pa'i shes pa skyed pa de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that a permanent sound produces an erroneous consciousness by the power of a cooperative condition.

original: rtag pa rnams ni lhan cig byed pa'i stobs kyis rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa rnams ni lhan cig byed pa'i stobs kyis rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because permanent things do not take on another aspect by the power of a cooperative condition.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu grags pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu grags pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words in that way and so on are the proponent of the philosophical tenet system. The word indeed is stated to indicate what is well known.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba lhan cig byed pa'i stobs kyi don dag la rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos yod pa @7b nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba lhan cig byed pa'i stobs kyi don dag la rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos yod pa @7b nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning of in that way is that there is an entity that has the characteristic of a transformation into another aspect in regard to the objects that are the power of the cooperating conditions.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rig byed pa'i sgra dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rig byed pa'i sgra dag la yang ngo //
translated: The word also means in regard to the words of the Vedas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sgra de dag kyang brda'i stobs las rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra de dag kyang brda'i stobs las rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those words also operate in another aspect due to the power of convention.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rdzes su byed pa can gyi brda'i stobs kyis rnam pa gzhan du don rtogs pa skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rdzes su byed pa can gyi brda'i stobs kyis rnam pa gzhan du don rtogs pa skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the power of the convention that is the desire of a person causes the production of the understanding of a meaning in another aspect.

original: ci ste brda'i stobs las de dag don dag la gzhan du gyur par ni mi 'dod mod kyi 'on kyang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid kyis rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni rang gi yul la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i
analyzed: ci ste brda'i stobs las de dag don dag la gzhan du gyur par ni mi 'dod mod kyi 'on kyang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid kyis rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni rang gi yul la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i
translated: But even though one does not assert that those words are different from their meanings due to the power of convention, still, because they are permanent, the expressive words are by nature the cause that generates consciousness of their object.

original: tshe rang gi yul la shes pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la gnas pa yin na yang rig byed pa'i sgra de dag brda la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe rang gi yul la shes pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la gnas pa yin na yang rig byed pa'i sgra de dag brda la sogs pa ste /
translated: At that time, even though the expressive words remain in their nature of generating the effect, consciousness of their object,

original: gdags pa la sogs pa ltos par bya ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni byed pa'i bya ba la sogs pa gzhan la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdags pa la sogs pa ltos par bya ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni byed pa'i bya ba la sogs pa gzhan la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are not dependent on causes such as the convention and so on, and because they are not dependent on other factors such as the action of the agent and so on,

original: rig byed kyi sgra de las skyes bu'i thams cad kyis thams cad kyi tshe don rtogs pa ste shes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rig byed kyi sgra de las skyes bu'i thams cad kyis thams cad kyi tshe don rtogs pa ste shes par 'gyur na /
translated: then the meaning would be understood or known by all persons at all times from those expressive words.

original: thams cad kyis thams cad kyi tshe na yang rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyis thams cad kyi tshe na yang rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and that it is not the case that all words always convey a meaning.

original: de bas na rig byed pa'i sgra brda la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa rnams ni don rtogs pa skyed pa'i phyir gnas par rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rig byed pa'i sgra brda la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa rnams ni don rtogs pa skyed pa'i phyir gnas par rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the existence of the Vedas is not established by the fact that they convey a meaning, without regard to the convention of the speaker.

original: 'on kyang brda la sogs pa la ltos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brda la sogs pa la ltos pa nyid yin no //
translated: Rather, they exist only in dependence on the convention of the speaker.

original: de dag kyang log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de dag kyang log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na /
translated: And since they are the cause of false cognition,

original: de'i gnas skabs can gyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs can gyi skyon yod do //
translated: they are the source of error.

original: gzhan yang sgra de ni ma byas par 'dod na ste sems par gyur na sgra ni shes pa nyid kyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra de ni ma byas par 'dod na ste sems par gyur na sgra ni shes pa nyid kyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you maintain that the sound of the Vedas is uncreated, then sound would not be the cause of cognition when it is created, i.e., when it is uttered.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa dag las dngos nus pa ste /üîΩrang gi ngo bo'i nye ba'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa dag las dngos nus pa ste / rang gi ngo bo'i nye ba'i nus pa ste /
translated: Because the effect of a permanent thing is not dependent on other things.üîΩThe effect of a permanent thing is not dependent on other things, because it is not dependent on other things.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not dependent on other things, because it is not dependent on other things.

original: shes pa'am gzhan 'ga' yang skye ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: shes pa'am gzhan 'ga' yang skye ba yod ma yin //
translated: Nor is there any other cause of the cognition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de //
translated: He explains this with ‚ÄúIf sound is unproduced, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te sgra ma byas pa yin na sgra de las don shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra ma byas pa yin na sgra de las don shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If sound is unproduced, then the cognition of the meaning from that sound would not occur.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba dang cig shos zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba dang cig shos zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcognition, etc.‚Äù is to be connected with the phrase ‚Äúat the time of its arising and not arising.‚Äù

original: dus dag ni skye ba dang cig shos kyi dus de dag tu'o //üîΩdes na shes pa'i sgra dang drug pa'i bsdu ba ste shes pa skye ba @8a * //
analyzed: dus dag ni skye ba dang cig shos kyi dus de dag tu'o // des na shes pa'i sgra dang drug pa'i bsdu ba ste shes pa skye ba @8a * //
translated: The ‚Äútimes‚Äù are the time of the arising of the cognition and the time of its not arising.

original: dang mi skye ba'i dus dag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang mi skye ba'i dus dag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the compound ‚Äúcognition-sound‚Äù is a sixth case tatpurusa compound, meaning ‚Äúat the time of the arising of the cognition and the time of its not arising.‚Äù

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir mtshungs pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir mtshungs pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Because it is permanent, it has a uniform nature.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa'i shes pa skyed pa la nus pa yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa'i shes pa skyed pa la nus pa yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible for a single nature to have the capacity to produce a cognition.

original: shes pa mi skye ba'i tshe gang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de nyid la gnas pa de ni skyed bar byed pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa mi skye ba'i tshe gang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de nyid la gnas pa de ni skyed bar byed pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: When consciousness does not arise, it is not the nature of that which generates it, and it is contradictory that it generates it.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa dang rnam pa gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa dang rnam pa gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be said that it generates it in one way and does not generate it in another way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar ngo bo 'dis rtag par mngon par 'dod pa 'di skyed par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo 'dis rtag par mngon par 'dod pa 'di skyed par byed pa yin /
translated: Because it is asserted that this permanent entity generates it in this way,üîΩbut it does not generate it in this way.

original: ngo bo 'di nyid kyis skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar ngo bo'i khyad par te rang bzhin gyi bye brag gang rnam par phye zhing tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo 'di nyid kyis skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar ngo bo'i khyad par te rang bzhin gyi bye brag gang rnam par phye zhing tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: There is no distinction in its nature, no difference in its intrinsic nature, that can be distinguished and established.

original: rtag pa ni thams cad kyi tshe ngo bo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni thams cad kyi tshe ngo bo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same entity at all times.

original: gal te rang bzhin gcig pa yin du zin kyang sngar skyed par byed pa ma yin zhing phyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba de ltar na gcig la yang rim gyis 'gal ba'i chos gnyis mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gcig pa yin du zin kyang sngar skyed par byed pa ma yin zhing phyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba de ltar na gcig la yang rim gyis 'gal ba'i chos gnyis mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Even if they were the same nature, it would not be tenable that what was not previously a producer would later become a producer, because it is contradictory for two contradictory attributes to occur sequentially in one thing.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, Aryadeva says:

original: rtag pa 'di skyed par byed pa ma yin pa ci 'dra ba nyid ni skyed par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa 'di skyed par byed pa ma yin pa ci 'dra ba nyid ni skyed par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: How could this permanent thing, which is not a producer, be a producer?

original: phyis kyang de'i gzhan skye ba ni med pa gang gis na skyed pa byed par 'gyur /üîΩgcig la yang rim gyis kyang 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyis kyang de'i gzhan skye ba ni med pa gang gis na skyed pa byed par 'gyur / gcig la yang rim gyis kyang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Later, it is not different from what it was before. By what means would it become a producer?üîΩBecause it is contradictory for two contradictory attributes to occur sequentially in one thing.

original: de gnas pa'i sgo nas kyang gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnas pa'i sgo nas kyang gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also contradictory for it to be one thing because it endures.

original: lhan cig byed pa lhag par thob nas phyis skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa lhag par thob nas phyis skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
translated: It is also wrong to say that it is a producer later when it obtains additional cooperating conditions.

original: 'di ltar gzhan la ltos pa yang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan la ltos pa yang ste /
translated: In that case, it would be dependent on another.

original: rtag ba'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yang sngar bkag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtag ba'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yang sngar bkag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, the permanent simultaneous cause has already been refuted.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin ba de bas na sgra rtag pa ni 'ga' zhig tu yang skyes bu'i shes pa skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin ba de bas na sgra rtag pa ni 'ga' zhig tu yang skyes bu'i shes pa skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the permanent sound is never able to produce the cognition of a person.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe shes pa mi skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe shes pa mi skyed pa yin na /
translated: If it does not produce the cognition at some time,

original: phyis kyang de nyid de dag gi rang bzhin nyid yin pas na rtag tu mi skyed par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang de nyid de dag gi rang bzhin nyid yin pas na rtag tu mi skyed par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then later also, because it is just that very nature of those, it follows that it is never produced.

original: ci ste skyon der ma gyur cig snyam pas de dag 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang mi skyed par mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste skyon der ma gyur cig snyam pas de dag 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang mi skyed par mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúLet us not have that fault,‚Äù and do not assert that it is never produced,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: that also is not possible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi yul gyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu @8b rtag tu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu @8b rtag tu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect of the cognition of its object is never seen.

original: sgra de dag rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang ste ji ltar yang byed pa po ma yin no zhes bya ba de mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgra de dag rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang ste ji ltar yang byed pa po ma yin no zhes bya ba de mang du bshad zin to //
translated: That sound is not a creator in any way whatsoever has already been explained extensively.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa dag las kyang 'ga' zhig ga tshe 'ga' zhig gi blo dag skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa dag las kyang 'ga' zhig ga tshe 'ga' zhig gi blo dag skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then awareness of something would arise from permanent things such as space.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause of their permanence,‚Äù etc.

original: rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa dag gi zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa smos pa ni de dag la dngos po'i gnas thabs kyis rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa dag gi zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa smos pa ni de dag la dngos po'i gnas thabs kyis rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù in ‚Äúbecause of their permanence, etc., as desired‚Äù is mentioned because permanence does not exist in the way they are imagined to be.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la rtogs pa 'byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la rtogs pa 'byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Whatever is imagined to arise from space, etc., is not of their nature.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la rag lus pa can gyi skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la rag lus pa can gyi skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Arising does not depend on the nature of space, etc.,

original: rtag pa dang ni rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ni rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for a permanent thing to function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for their arising?

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù etc.

original: thog ma med pa'i rigs mthun pa'i kun rtog des bsgos pa'i bag chags kyi nus pa de las byung zhing skye ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i rigs mthun pa'i kun rtog des bsgos pa'i bag chags kyi nus pa de las byung zhing skye ba'o //
translated: It arises from the power of the latent impressions that are infused by the conception of the type that has been homogeneous since beginningless [time].

original: lung ji lta ba bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de'i sgro btags spyod yul can gyi blo dag / der snang ba can nyid ni de 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: lung ji lta ba bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de'i sgro btags spyod yul can gyi blo dag / der snang ba can nyid ni de 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The cognition that has as its object the superimposition of that aspect, such as space, and so on, just as it is stated in scripture, is only that which appears as that.

original: de ltar blo'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la phyir rol du nges par byas nas phyi rol nyid du btags pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa de la skye 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba de ltar 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de ltar blo'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la phyir rol du nges par byas nas phyi rol nyid du btags pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa de la skye 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba de ltar 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur gyi //
translated: Thus, having ascertained the aspect of conceptual cognition as external, that space, and so on, which is imputed as external, is only a mistake, as it is said, ‚Äúarises in that way.‚Äù

original: de don spyod yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: de don spyod yul can ma yin te /
translated: It is not the object of that meaning.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin te //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin te //
translated: It is not the object of its own characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: It explains with ‚Äúown characteristic,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo gang la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul yod pa'i blo de'i na nges par rang gi mtshan nyid de'i rung ba nyid de nus pa'o //
analyzed: blo gang la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul yod pa'i blo de'i na nges par rang gi mtshan nyid de'i rung ba nyid de nus pa'o //
translated: The cognition that has an object that is characterized by intrinsic identity is necessarily capable of that intrinsic identity.

original: de'i nye bar te thag nye ba de'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can de yod pas yod pa can yin pa'i phyir blo 'di'i rgyur rung zhing nus pa gang yin pa'i rgyu de las nus pa yod na blo der gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i nye bar te thag nye ba de'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can de yod pas yod pa can yin pa'i phyir blo 'di'i rgyur rung zhing nus pa gang yin pa'i rgyu de las nus pa yod na blo der gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it exists in the proximity of that, it is in the nature of that, and since it exists in that, it is capable of that. Therefore, the cause that is capable of being the cause of this cognition is the cause that is capable of that. If it exists, it is that cognition.

original: de ltar de rigs pa la gnas pa de ltar na gal te dngos po rtag pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la skyes bu 'ga' zhig gi shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyu rtag pa nye ba'i phyir skyes bu thams cad kyi thams cad @9a * //
analyzed: de ltar de rigs pa la gnas pa de ltar na gal te dngos po rtag pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la skyes bu 'ga' zhig gi shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rgyu rtag pa nye ba'i phyir skyes bu thams cad kyi thams cad @9a * //
translated: Thus, if the cognition of some person arises with respect to the intrinsic identity of permanent things, then at that time, since the permanent cause is proximate, the cognition of all persons would occur at all times.

original: kyi tsher 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyi tsher 'gyur te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: rtag pa lhan cig byed pa la ltos pas 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'ga' zhig gi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa lhan cig byed pa la ltos pas 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'ga' zhig gi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since a permanent thing does not depend on cooperating causes, it does not produce the cognition of some person at some time.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba 'bras bu'i bya ba lhan cig byed pa dag gis khyad par du byas pa gsal ba gang dag la yod pa dag ni gsal ba can dag go //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba 'bras bu'i bya ba lhan cig byed pa dag gis khyad par du byas pa gsal ba gang dag la yod pa dag ni gsal ba can dag go //
translated: Thus, those things that are manifest, which are qualified by the activity of the effect that is to be generated, which is the activity of the effect, are ‚Äúpossessing manifestation.‚Äù

original: yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs nges pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la nye bar sbyar ba na ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs nges pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la nye bar sbyar ba na ste /
translated: When they are applied to some effect by some aspect that is determined in terms of place, time, and occasion,

original: gtan tshigs nyid du bstan ba na 'bras bu de skyed par rung ba'i phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de thob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i khyad par la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid du bstan ba na 'bras bu de skyed par rung ba'i phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de thob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i khyad par la ltos pa ste /
translated: when they are taught as the reason, they are dependent on the special state of being the cause of attaining that which is the nature of being the most excellent that is fit to generate that effect.

original: lhan cig byed pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúin regard to the cooperating causes.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba mi rtag pa dang 'dra bar rtag pa'i dngos po'i 'bras bu'i khyad par can ma yin pa phul du byung bar byar med pa can /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba mi rtag pa dang 'dra bar rtag pa'i dngos po'i 'bras bu'i khyad par can ma yin pa phul du byung bar byar med pa can /
translated: Thus, like impermanence, permanence does not have a special effect that is most excellent, which is the effect of a permanent thing.

original: de'i rgyu la ltos pa can te 'dzin pa'i lhan cig byed ba'i rgyu la ltos pa can skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis gzung bar gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu la ltos pa can te 'dzin pa'i lhan cig byed ba'i rgyu la ltos pa can skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis gzung bar gyur pa na'o //
translated: it is dependent on the cause of that, i.e., on the cause that is the cooperating condition of grasping, when it is grasped by some person.

original: gal te skyes bu 'di'i 'dzin pa skyed par 'gyur ba na skyes bu de nyid kyis gzung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de rigs pa yin te lhan cig byed pa so sor des pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu 'di'i 'dzin pa skyed par 'gyur ba na skyes bu de nyid kyis gzung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de rigs pa yin te lhan cig byed pa so sor des pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the case that when the grasping of this person is produced, it is grasped by that very person and not by another, then that is reasonable, because the cooperating conditions are distinct.

original: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu'i khyad par can zhes rjod par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu'i khyad par can zhes rjod par byed de /
translated: Others say that it is called the effect that has a special nature.

original: de'i tshe na thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the reductio is established.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas skyed par byed pa de yang rtag pa la srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas skyed par byed pa de yang rtag pa la srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the production that is dependent on the cooperating conditions is not possible for a permanent thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brtan pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtan pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of its stable nature.

original: rtag pa ni lhan cig byed pas phul du byung ba nyid du byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa ni lhan cig byed pas phul du byung ba nyid du byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a permanent thing cannot be made to surpass itself by the cooperating conditions.

original: de bas na rtag tu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu thams cad kyis cig car te /
analyzed: de bas na rtag tu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu thams cad kyis cig car te /
translated: Therefore, because it always exists as the nature of a generator, all persons would simultaneously

original: dus gcig tu gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: grasp it.

original: ci ste rtag tu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi skyed ba'i phyir ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste rtag tu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi skyed ba'i phyir ma yin na /
translated: But if it always exists as the nature of a generator and it is not that it does not generate at some times,

original: de'i tshe yang mi skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dod pa na 'di'i mi skyed pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ni phyis kyang yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang mi skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dod pa na 'di'i mi skyed pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ni phyis kyang yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then at that time, when it is asserted that it does not generate, it is the nature of a non-generator.

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe bzung ba ma yin no zhes de ltar nges pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe bzung ba ma yin no zhes de ltar nges pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then just as it is not grasped by some persons at some times, it is not grasped by any person at any time.

original: gal te @9b skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu rtag pa'i dngos po yod cing bdog ba dus gcig gi tshe mthong bar gyur pa de'i tshe rtag pa de 'ga' zhig gi yang dbang po las 'das par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing rtag tu dbangüîΩpos gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur te //
analyzed: gal te @9b skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu rtag pa'i dngos po yod cing bdog ba dus gcig gi tshe mthong bar gyur pa de'i tshe rtag pa de 'ga' zhig gi yang dbang po las 'das par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing rtag tu dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur te //
translated: If some person at some time sees a permanent thing that exists and is present, then that permanent thing is not beyond the senses of anyone, and it is always apprehended by the senses.

original: thams cad du skyes bu thams cad la rtag ba'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du skyes bu thams cad la rtag ba'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the permanent nature of all persons at all times.

original: rtag ba de'i yang rtag pa'i shes pa skyed par byed ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag ba de'i yang rtag pa'i shes pa skyed par byed ba yod pa yin no //
translated: And the permanent thing produces a permanent cognition.

original: de bas na don gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na don gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not dependent on the potentiality of the object.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid can gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid can gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not dependent on the potentiality of the characteristics of space, etc.

original: sgro btags ba'i spyod yul can ni lung ji lta ba bzhin du sgro btags pa can te /
analyzed: sgro btags ba'i spyod yul can ni lung ji lta ba bzhin du sgro btags pa can te /
translated: The object of superimposition is that which has the nature of superimposition according to scripture.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rnam pa can du snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it appears in the form of space, etc.

original: nang nyid kyi nye bar len pa ste rgyu la brten nas so //
analyzed: nang nyid kyi nye bar len pa ste rgyu la brten nas so //
translated: It is based on the internal appropriation, i.e., the cause.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags sad pa ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags sad pa ste /
translated: What is it like? It is the activation of the latent impressions of conceptualization.

original: nam mkha' la sogs ba'i rnam par rtog pa thog ma med pa can gyis bsgos pa'i bag chags de sad pa ni 'bras bu skyes pa'i phyir mngon du phyogs pa'o //üîΩdon gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis phyi rol yi stong pa dag yin mod kyi gang gi phyir phyi rol don gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs ba'i rnam par rtog pa thog ma med pa can gyis bsgos pa'i bag chags de sad pa ni 'bras bu skyes pa'i phyir mngon du phyogs pa'o // don gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis phyi rol yi stong pa dag yin mod kyi gang gi phyir phyi rol don gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The latent impressions that have been infused by beginningless conceptualization of space, etc., are activated, i.e., they are directed toward the arising of the effect.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi stong pa dag ces bya ba'i tshig de nyid kyi 'bras bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi stong pa dag ces bya ba'i tshig de nyid kyi 'bras bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout regard to the potentiality of the object‚Äù indicates that, although they are empty of external objects, they are the effect of the phrase ‚Äúempty of external objects.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni don gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis don gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni don gyi nus pa la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis don gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis bkag pa yin te /
translated: Others believe that the phrase ‚Äúwithout regard to the potentiality of the object‚Äù negates the aspect of the object‚Äôs particular characteristic and its universal characteristic.

original: don gyi nus pa ni rnam pa skyed ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa de la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi nus pa ni rnam pa skyed ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa de la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: The potency of the object is characterized by the production of an image, and it is not dependent on that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgro btags ba'i spyod yul can zhes smos so //üîΩ'dod par ni 'gyur na gal te yang nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de lta na yang mig la sogs pa dang 'dra bar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgro btags ba'i spyod yul can zhes smos so // 'dod par ni 'gyur na gal te yang nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de lta na yang mig la sogs pa dang 'dra bar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: For that very reason, it is said that they have an imagined object.üîΩIf it were so, then even if it did not conform to space, etc.,

original: phyi rol gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de yang bdag po tsam gyi nye bar sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de yang bdag po tsam gyi nye bar sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
translated: like the eye, etc., the eye consciousness, etc. would be connected to the mere dominant condition of the external form, etc.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pa dag ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are empty of external objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don bdag por gyur pa stong pa dag kyang zhes smra'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don bdag por gyur pa stong pa dag kyang zhes smra'o //
translated: They are also said to be empty of external objects as dominant conditions.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la skyes bu thams cad kyi 'khrul pa de @10a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la skyes bu thams cad kyi 'khrul pa de @10a * //
translated: The error of all persons with regard to space, etc.

original: lta bu'i ngo bo can skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta bu'i ngo bo can skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: arises in the form of that.

original: rtag pa dag las 'bras bu skye ba med do zhes bya ba der gnas so //
analyzed: rtag pa dag las 'bras bu skye ba med do zhes bya ba der gnas so //
translated: The effect does not arise from permanent things.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sgra rnams kyi 'bras bu shes pa snang ba de bas na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sgra rnams kyi 'bras bu shes pa snang ba de bas na /
translated: At some time, the effect of sound is the appearance of consciousness.

original: sgra rnams ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i chos can ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rnams ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i chos can ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, sound is not a phenomenon that does not change into something else.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid gcig las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i chos yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid gcig las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i chos yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has a nature that does not change from one state to another‚Äù is to be applied to this.

original: 'on kyang brda'i stobs las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang brda'i stobs las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: However, it changes into another state due to the power of convention.

original: ci ste sgra dag rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can du mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin pa de'i tshe rig byed pa'i sgra rnams de kho na nyid yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste sgra dag rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can du mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin pa de'i tshe rig byed pa'i sgra rnams de kho na nyid yin par 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not assert that sound changes into another state, but rather that it has a permanent, single nature, then at that time, if you assert that the sound of the Vedas is reality,

original: don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa can rig byed pa'i sgra yin no zhes bya ba de gang las yin /
analyzed: don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa can rig byed pa'i sgra yin no zhes bya ba de gang las yin /
translated: then what is the basis for the assertion that the sound of the Vedas is the means of understanding reality without error?

original: gang dag las don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te //
analyzed: gang dag las don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who understand the meaning of the words without error‚Äù should be applied to the following.

original: don phyin ci log tu rtogs pa can du yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: don phyin ci log tu rtogs pa can du yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt they also understand the meaning in a distorted way?üîΩIf they did, then because the Vedic statements ‚ÄúFire is the remedy for cold‚Äù and so on are undistorted, they would all be undistorted.

original: 'dod par ni 'gyur na me ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed pa'i ngag ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin no snyam pa de'i phyir /üîΩme ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod par ni 'gyur na me ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed pa'i ngag ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin no snyam pa de'i phyir / me ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to that, the root text says, ‚ÄúFire is not the remedy for cold,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe Vedic statements ‚ÄúFire is the remedy for cold, that is, for being cold‚Äù and so on are not undistorted.

original: me ni kha ba ste grang ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rig byed kyi ngag rnams la yang me ni grang ba 'joms par nus pa rig byed kyi ngag las sngar yang brda ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa
analyzed: me ni kha ba ste grang ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rig byed kyi ngag rnams la yang me ni grang ba 'joms par nus pa rig byed kyi ngag las sngar yang brda ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pa
translated: In the world, prior to the Vedic statements, fire is known to be able to destroy cold in accordance with its meaning.

original: la grags pas bstan pas rig byed kyi ngag don la ma mthong ba thams cad kyang phyin ci ma log pa de ltar 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: la grags pas bstan pas rig byed kyi ngag don la ma mthong ba thams cad kyang phyin ci ma log pa de ltar 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the Vedas is not seen by everyone, and it is not the case that all of them are unmistaken.

original: 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i don la 'jig rten pa ni rang gi brda'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i don la 'jig rten pa ni rang gi brda'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: The meaning that is well known in the world is that the world, following its own conventions,

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa ma mthong ba de bas na 'jig rten ni rang gi 'dod pas byas pa'i brda gang yin pa'i rjes su ste /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa ma mthong ba de bas na 'jig rten ni rang gi 'dod pas byas pa'i brda gang yin pa'i rjes su ste /
translated: does not see the designation of conventions. Therefore, the world is uncertain, following the conventions that are created by its own desires.

original: phyis brda'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir the tshom za ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyis brda'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir the tshom za ba nyid yin no //
translated: Later, it designates conventions following those conventions.

original: 'jig rten 'di rang gi brda'i rjes su byed cing rjes su 'brang bas me ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba'i dag las ci de ltar me ni grang ba zlog par nus pa yin no zhes rtogs shing nges sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di rang gi brda'i rjes su byed cing rjes su 'brang bas me ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba'i dag las ci de ltar me ni grang ba zlog par nus pa yin no zhes rtogs shing nges sam /
translated: The world follows its own conventions. When it says, ‚ÄúFire is the remedy for cold,‚Äù does it understand and ascertain that fire has the ability to remove cold?

original: 'on te sgra'i rang bzhin gnas pa las te /
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i rang bzhin gnas pa las te /
translated: Or does it understand that from the nature of the word?

original: sgra'i @10b rang bzhin 'jug pa'i nus pa'i nges pa las de ltar rtogs pa yin zhe'o /
analyzed: sgra'i @10b rang bzhin 'jug pa'i nus pa'i nges pa las de ltar rtogs pa yin zhe'o /
translated: and it is understood in that way from the certainty of the power of the nature of the sound to engage.

original: gang gi tshe rig byed pa'i sgra'i don mthong ba nyid la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rig byed pa'i sgra'i don mthong ba nyid la /
translated: When one sees the meaning of the words of the Vedas,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis don bstan par nus pa la the tshom za ba de'i tshe shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la shin tu srid pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis don bstan par nus pa la the tshom za ba de'i tshe shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la shin tu srid pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: one doubts whether the meaning is taught by the nature of the words themselves, and at that time it is very possible that the meaning is extremely obscure.

original: 'jig rten pa'i grags pa'i rjes su byed pas rig byed pa dag gi yang don gsal bar byed pa yin du chug na yang 'jig rten la grags pa de ni sgra rnams kyi ji ltar gnas pa'i nus pa gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i grags pa'i rjes su byed pas rig byed pa dag gi yang don gsal bar byed pa yin du chug na yang 'jig rten la grags pa de ni sgra rnams kyi ji ltar gnas pa'i nus pa gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if the meaning of the Vedas is clarified by following what is known in the world, the meaning known in the world clarifies the power of the words as it is.

original: thams cad la ngo bo gcig pa can nyid kyis bden pa'i don can yin pa de bas na thams cad la rig byed pa dag gi don phyin ci ma log pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir 'jig rten gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: thams cad la ngo bo gcig pa can nyid kyis bden pa'i don can yin pa de bas na thams cad la rig byed pa dag gi don phyin ci ma log pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir 'jig rten gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Since all of them have the same nature, they have the meaning of truth. Therefore, the meaning of the Vedas is unmistaken.üîΩTo respond:

original: smos te / sgra dag gzhan du gyur pa yin na ste /
analyzed: smos te / sgra dag gzhan du gyur pa yin na ste /
translated: If the words of the Vedas were transformed,

original: brda ji lta ba bzhin du don dag la 'god par bya ba yin na'o //
analyzed: brda ji lta ba bzhin du don dag la 'god par bya ba yin na'o //
translated: they would be arranged in accordance with the meaning of the conventions.

original: gzhan la ste yul gzhan la sogs par rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ste yul gzhan la sogs par rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa la'o //
translated: In other places, in other countries, and so on, they would be transformed in other ways.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni don gzhan dgod pas gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni don gzhan dgod pas gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn other ways‚Äù means they would be transformed by arranging other meanings.

original: snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i rjes su byed pas khas len pa la yang rig byed kyi sgra de dag rnam pa gzhan te /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i rjes su byed pas khas len pa la yang rig byed kyi sgra de dag rnam pa gzhan te /

original: log pa'i don can nyid du 'gyur ba srid de grags pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid du 'gyur ba srid de grags pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is possible that they have a mistaken meaning, because they do not remain well known.

original: de bas na ma ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi ngag 'ga' zhig phyin ci ma log pa mthong du zin kyang /üîΩmtho ris 'dod pas mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi dag thams cad de lta bu'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de bas na ma ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi ngag 'ga' zhig phyin ci ma log pa mthong du zin kyang / mtho ris 'dod pas mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi dag thams cad de lta bu'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Therefore, although some Vedic statements, such as ‚ÄúThe mother is the friend of the child,‚Äù are seen to be nonerroneous,

original: bden pa'i don can du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i don can du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: all Vedic statements, such as ‚ÄúOne should perform sacrifice in order to attain heaven,‚Äù are not established as having a true meaning.

original: gal te ma byas pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir rig byed pa'i sgra dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis bden pa'i don can nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma byas pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir rig byed pa'i sgra dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis bden pa'i don can nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúVedic statements have a true meaning because they are by nature unfabricated,‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúThose statements . . .‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba rig byed pa'i sgra ni bden pa'i don can nyid du nges pa dang 'dra bar sgra 'ga' zhig log pa'i don can nyid du nges pas kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba rig byed pa'i sgra ni bden pa'i don can nyid du nges pa dang 'dra bar sgra 'ga' zhig log pa'i don can nyid du nges pas kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù is like the certainty that the words of the Vedas have a true meaning. In the same way, some words are ascertained to have a false meaning.üîΩBecause of that, the reason is not established.

original: phyir te gtan tshigs kyis rang bzhin yongs su shes pa med pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni log pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba de ltar @11a * //
analyzed: phyir te gtan tshigs kyis rang bzhin yongs su shes pa med pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni log pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba de ltar @11a * //
translated: This shows that the meaning is false.

original: rnam par phye ba'i sgo nas sgra'i rang bzhin nges par byas pa med pa sgra thams cad la the tshom du 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par phye ba'i sgo nas sgra'i rang bzhin nges par byas pa med pa sgra thams cad la the tshom du 'gyur /
translated: Thus, because of the absence of ascertainment of the nature of the reason, there is doubt about all words.

original: rig byed pa'i ngag ni bden pa'i don can yin te ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la gal te rjes su 'gro ba med pa de ltar na yang ldog pa tsam las bden pa'i don can nyid du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: rig byed pa'i ngag ni bden pa'i don can yin te ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la gal te rjes su 'gro ba med pa de ltar na yang ldog pa tsam las bden pa'i don can nyid du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba
translated: The words of the Vedas have a true meaning because they are not made. In this syllogism, even if there is no positive concomitance, the true meaning is established by mere negative concomitance.

original: ni kha cig gi yin no //
analyzed: ni kha cig gi yin no //
translated: This is the position of some.

original: de ltar ni bden pa'i don can nyid dang log pa'i don can nyid dag gis thams cad la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni bden pa'i don can nyid dang log pa'i don can nyid dag gis thams cad la khyab pa yin te /
translated: Thus, all are pervaded by having a true meaning and having a false meaning,

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another possibility is impossible.

original: log pa'i don can nyid kyang byas pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid kyang byas pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: Also, having a false meaning is pervaded by being produced.

original: gang du khyad par byed pa byas pa nyid log pa der log pa'i don can nyid log pas rig byed kyi ngag ma byas pa la yang /
analyzed: gang du khyad par byed pa byas pa nyid log pa der log pa'i don can nyid log pas rig byed kyi ngag ma byas pa la yang /
translated: Where the qualifier, being produced, is refuted, there having a false meaning is refuted. Therefore, even with respect to the words of the Vedas that are not produced,üîΩbeing produced is refuted, and when that is refuted, having a false meaning is also refuted.

original: byas pa nyid log cing de log pas log pa'i don can nyid kyang log na de log pa'i tshe rig byed kyi ngag bden pa'i don can du grub pa de nyid phyogs snga ma dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa nyid log cing de log pas log pa'i don can nyid kyang log na de log pa'i tshe rig byed kyi ngag bden pa'i don can du grub pa de nyid phyogs snga ma dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: When that is refuted, the words of the Vedas are established as having a true meaning.üîΩTo present the opponent‚Äôs position, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúIf you say . . .‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te byas pa log pa nyid //üîΩmthong ba nyid kyi phyir na tshig / ma byas pa bden don can yin te //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te byas pa log pa nyid // mthong ba nyid kyi phyir na tshig / ma byas pa bden don can yin te //
translated: If you say that the wordsüîΩof the Vedas that are not producedüîΩhave a true meaning

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because you see that being produced is refuted,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then what is the point of the Vedas?

original: log pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: log pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe reason, etc.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs ma byas pa nyid ldog pa byas pa nyid gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma byas pa nyid ldog pa byas pa nyid gang yin pa des so //
translated: The reason is non-producedness, and the probandum is producedness.

original: 'gal ba khyab phyir ro zhes bya ba bden pa'i don can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba log pa'i don can nyid de de la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba khyab phyir ro zhes bya ba bden pa'i don can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba log pa'i don can nyid de de la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the pervasion of the contradictory‚Äù means that the probandum is the fact of having a real object, and the contradictory of that is the fact of having a unreal object, and that is pervaded by the reason.

original: log pas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i drug pa yin te /
analyzed: log pas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i drug pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe unreal‚Äù is the genitive of the agent.

original: gtan tshigs ldog pa byas pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba log pa de'i don can nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ldog pa byas pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba log pa de'i don can nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the reason, non-producedness, is pervaded by the probandum, the fact of having a real object, and the contradictory of that, the fact of having an unreal object.üîΩIf someone says, ‚ÄúThe reason, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning is that the reason, non-producedness, is pervaded by the probandum, the fact of having a real object, and the contradictory of that, the fact of having an unreal object.üîΩIf someone says, ‚ÄúThe reason, etc.‚Äù

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de log pa'i don can gyi tshig gang yin pa ma lus shing lus pa med pa ni byas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma byas pa nyid log pas byas pas bsgrub par bya ba log pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de log pa'i don can gyi tshig gang yin pa ma lus shing lus pa med pa ni byas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma byas pa nyid log pas byas pas bsgrub par bya ba log pa ste /
translated: He explains that the reason, non-producedness, is pervaded by the probandum, the fact of having a real object, and the contradictory of that, the fact of having an unreal object.

original: bden pa'i don can gyi bsgrub par bya ba de log pa'i don can de la khyab pa'i phyir gzhan ma byas pa la yang log pa'i don can nyid mi srid pa'i rgyus ma byas pa ni bden pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba
analyzed: bden pa'i don can gyi bsgrub par bya ba de log pa'i don can de la khyab pa'i phyir gzhan ma byas pa la yang log pa'i don can nyid mi srid pa'i rgyus ma byas pa ni bden pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba
translated: Because the probandum that has the meaning of true is pervaded by the meaning of false, it is impossible that what is not created has the meaning of false. Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not created‚Äù has the meaning of true.

original: med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The pervasion is reversed.

original: @11b rig byed kyi ngag ni bden pa'i don can yin te /
analyzed: @11b rig byed kyi ngag ni bden pa'i don can yin te /
translated: The statement of the Vedas has the meaning of true,üîΩbecause it is not created.

original: ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la gal te rjes su 'gro ba med pa de lta na yang rjes su 'gro ba med par yang grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la gal te rjes su 'gro ba med pa de lta na yang rjes su 'gro ba med par yang grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this syllogism, if there is no pervasion, then even without a pervasion, it would be established. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar khyab par bya bar 'dod pa'i don gang la khyab par byed par 'dod pa gang gis ma khyab na khyab par bya bar 'dod pa ldog pa de la khyab par byed pa ldog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyab par bya bar 'dod pa'i don gang la khyab par byed par 'dod pa gang gis ma khyab na khyab par bya bar 'dod pa ldog pa de la khyab par byed pa ldog pa ste /
translated: Thus, if the object that is the predicate of the probandum is not pervaded by the object that is the predicate of the reason, then the predicate of the probandum is reversed, and the predicate of the reason is also reversed.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i chos 'di yang 'di la srid par 'gyur ro zhes dogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i chos 'di yang 'di la srid par 'gyur ro zhes dogs par bya'o //
translated: and it is possible that this phenomenon, which is of a different type, will occur in this case.

original: de skad du gal te log pa'i don can nyid la byas pa nyid khyab par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe byas pa de ldog pa'i ma byas pa nyid log pa'i don can nyid la srid par 'gyur na de yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad du gal te log pa'i don can nyid la byas pa nyid khyab par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe byas pa de ldog pa'i ma byas pa nyid log pa'i don can nyid la srid par 'gyur na de yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were not the case that being a product is pervaded by having a deceptive object, then it would be possible that the opposite of being a product, that is, being nonproduct, would occur in having a deceptive object, but that does not occur in this case.

original: byas pa nyid kyis log pa'i don can nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyis log pa'i don can nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because being a product pervades having a deceptive object.

original: 'gal ba khyab pa la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba khyab pa la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no contradiction in a pervasion being contradictory.

original: 'di ltar byas pa dang ma byas pa 'gal ba dag ni log pa'i don can gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa dang ma byas pa 'gal ba dag ni log pa'i don can gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, being a product and being nonproduct, which are contradictory, do not occur in a single deceptive object.

original: log pa'i don can nyid la byas pa med na yang byas pa'i rigs mi mthun pa'i don la bden pa'i don can nyid dang log pa'i don can dag las rnam par gzhan med pas gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas ma byas pa las log pa'i
analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid la byas pa med na yang byas pa'i rigs mi mthun pa'i don la bden pa'i don can nyid dang log pa'i don can dag las rnam par gzhan med pas gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas ma byas pa las log pa'i
translated: If the non-produced is not the opposite of the produced, then it is not different from that which has a true meaning and that which has a false meaning, because it is not a different type from the produced.üîΩIf the non-produced, which is the opposite of the produced in the manner just explained, is not the opposite of that which has a false meaning, then the non-produced would not be that which has a true meaning.

original: don can log pa yang ma byas pa nyid bden pa'i don can du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe ma byas pa de la rnam pa gzhan ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: don can log pa yang ma byas pa nyid bden pa'i don can du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe ma byas pa de la rnam pa gzhan ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: But at that time, what other aspect would the non-produced have?

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba med par yang 'dod pa'i don ma byas pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba med par yang 'dod pa'i don ma byas pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, even without concomitance, the non-produced, which is the object of desire, is established, and it is the proof of that.

original: rtags ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med pa yin no //
translated: Because the reason is the proof of the object of desire, it is pointless to teach concomitance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa'i ldog pa can nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni bden te zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa'i ldog pa can nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni bden te zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi yin te /
translated: The master [BhƒÅviveka] says, ‚ÄúThat is true,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog pa sgrub pa yod na bsgrub par bya ba grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni bden te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog pa sgrub pa yod na bsgrub par bya ba grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni bden te /
translated: If the reversal of the reason in the discordant class is established, then the probandum is established. That is true.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bden pa'i don can dang ma byas pa nyid dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs log pa'i don can dang byas pa dang byas pa gang yin pa de dag gi khyab @12a * //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bden pa'i don can dang ma byas pa nyid dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs log pa'i don can dang byas pa dang byas pa gang yin pa de dag gi khyab @12a * //
translated: If the probandum and the proof have a true meaning and nonproduction, and the discordant class has a false meaning and is produced, and that which is produced is established,

original: par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo grub par 'gyur na ste /
analyzed: par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo grub par 'gyur na ste /
translated: then the nature of the pervasion between the pervader and the pervaded would be established.

original: gal te byas pa nyid kyis log pa'i don can yid la khyab pa grub par gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid kyis log pa'i don can yid la khyab pa grub par gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it were established that production pervades a false meaning, then that would be the meaning of ‚Äúif production establishes that a false meaning is produced.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe byas pa nyid kyis log pa'i don can la khyab pa las ma byas pa nyid log par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe byas pa nyid kyis log pa'i don can la khyab pa las ma byas pa nyid log par gyur na /
translated: At that time, by virtue of the fact that the non-produced is pervaded by the non-erroneous, the non-produced would become the opposite of the erroneous.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la grub pa ma yin no /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la grub pa ma yin no /
translated: And that nature of the pervaded and the pervader is not established in the discordant class.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po sum cu gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu gsum pa /
translated: Chapter 33

original: ji ltar zhe na 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How is that? It is stated:

analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs log pa'i don can nyid la med phyir te /
translated: Because it does not exist in the discordant class of the probandum, which has the meaning of the opposite.

original: mi srid pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: This is the reason for impossibility.

original: gnod pa can gyi gtan tshigs ma bstan na'ang ste /
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi gtan tshigs ma bstan na'ang ste /
translated: Even if a contradictory reason is not stated,

analyzed: log pa'i don can dang ma byas par yang 'gyur ro zhes bzlog pa'i gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de ni yod par dogs 'gyur te //
translated: that is suspected to exist.

original: log pa'i don nyid de la ji ltar log pa'i don can byas pa yin pa de ltar ma byas par yang 'gyur ro zhes ma byas pa nyid la yang ngo //
analyzed: log pa'i don nyid de la ji ltar log pa'i don can byas pa yin pa de ltar ma byas par yang 'gyur ro zhes ma byas pa nyid la yang ngo //

original: gal te ji ltar na byas pa nyid dang ma byas pa nyid 'gal ba dag log pa'i don can nyid kyi chos can gcig gis rjes su 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar na byas pa nyid dang ma byas pa nyid 'gal ba dag log pa'i don can nyid kyi chos can gcig gis rjes su 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that being a real thing and being an unreal thing, which are mutually exclusive, are the properties that are pervaded by the property of being the object of negation?

original: 'di la nyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no fault here.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause a single property pervades all things.‚Äù

original: yang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /

analyzed: dngos po 'gal ba dag la yang chos gcig khyab par byed pa mthong phyir ro //
translated: Because a single property is seen to pervade all things, even those that are mutually exclusive.

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de bden pa'i don can nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma byas pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs log pa'i don can nyid la med par grub par 'gyur ba de'i tshe
translated: The response to that is stated by ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on. The reason that proves the meaning of true is established as not existing in the opposite of the object of affirmation, the meaning of false.

original: bden pa'i don can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba log pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i don can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba log pa ste /

analyzed: log pa'i don can de la ma byas pa nyid de med pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma @12b yang ma mthong ngo //

analyzed: gal te skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed pa'i ngag gis log pa'i don can nyid la 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: mi 'gal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid dang mi 'gal ba skyes bus ma byas pa nyid sgrub pa yang log pa'i don can dgag pa sgrub par byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to prove that the meaning is not erroneous and that it is not produced by a person by refuting the meaning is erroneous, because that is too broad.

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / thal ches pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid la log pa'i don can nyid mthong yang de dang 'gal ba ma byas pa nyid la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de gang gi phyir byas pa gcig la log pa'i don can mthong ba yang gzhan ma byas pa la med pa nyid ma yin te /

analyzed: gsal ba tha dad pas 'gal ba dag la yang chos gcig kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'gal ba'i don dag dang gcig tu 'byung ba dag kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid dang cig shos dag la mi rtag pa nyid bzhin te /

analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na tshig ma byas pa ni 'ga' zhig tu log pa'i don la 'jug par mi snang ngo zhe na /

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúin that way,‚Äù etc.

analyzed: 'di ltar sdang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs thams cad du ni mi dmigs phyir /

analyzed: med nyid mi grub ces ni bshad zin to //

original: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi med pa nyid ma grub na /
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi med pa nyid ma grub na /

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nyid la the tshom @13a * //

original: za ; skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: za ; skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: He explains with ‚Äúperson‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: skyes bu tsam 'dis zhes bya ba tshu rol mthong bas dngos po thams cad mthong bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: This mere person is not able to see all things by seeing one thing,

analyzed: gang gis na skyes bu 'di'i mthong ba ldog pas de ltar 'gyur te dngos po med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: by what seeing of this person would it be excluded in that way, it would not become non-existent‚Äîthis is the meaning.

analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba'i shes pas shes bya la ma khyab pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de'i shes pa log tu zin kyang shes bya med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: 'o na gang gi shes pa log par gyur pa na shes bya ldog ce na /

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: @13b de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed de /

analyzed: thams cad mthong ba'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa gang gis ma byas pa'i tshig dag ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la mi slu ba'am /

analyzed: cig shos kyi bya ba byas pa'i tshig ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la'o //

analyzed: cig shos la nges pa ste /

original: de nyid ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: de ltar ni de ltar ma mthong ba nyid kyis te /

analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyi mtshan nyid can gyi mi dmigs pa 'di ni mi snang ba'i bdag nyid can yin te /

analyzed: mi snang ba'i ngo bo can gyi don dag ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //

analyzed: sgrub par byed pa bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can ci 'dra ba de yang 'di la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
