analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin par bkag pas dngos po la reg pa'i phyir /
translated: But since it is not a negation of the nature of the self, it does not touch upon the real thing.

original: kho bo cag gis bshad pa'i bdag med pa'i de nyid thob bo //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis bshad pa'i bdag med pa'i de nyid thob bo //
translated: Thus, one attains the reality of selflessness as we have explained it.

original: de ltar na re zhig dpyod pa pa 'di'i bsgrub par bya ba log pa bral ba tsam ste /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig dpyod pa pa 'di'i bsgrub par bya ba log pa bral ba tsam ste /
translated: Thus, the thesis of the Analyst is only the mere absence of the probandum,

original: rnam par bcad pas bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba don gyis gzung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pas bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba don gyis gzung ba nyid yin no //
translated: because the probandum is established by the exclusion. Therefore, the pervasion is implicitly grasped.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that all reasons have pervasion.

original: da ni rigs pa pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: da ni rigs pa pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, from the standpoint of the logicians,

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrigs pa pa gang gis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo rnam par bcad pa tsam ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rigs pa pa gang gis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo rnam par bcad pa tsam ma yin pa ste /
translated: he says ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The logicians say that the mere exclusion of the nature of non-entity is not the negatee of the probandum,üîΩbut rather the nature of entity is the negatee.

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i chos nyid yin no //üîΩde skad du brjod pa'i rigs pa pa de'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i chos nyid yin no // de skad du brjod pa'i rigs pa pa de'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pa ste /
translated: However, it is the nature of entity itself.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo log pa'i don can nyid rnam par gcod pa yin na yang bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo log pa'i don can nyid rnam par gcod pa yin na yang bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the exclusion of the nature of entity, which is the probandum, is the exclusion of the meaning of the negation of the nature of entity, which is the negatee, then the nature of the probandum is not established.

original: log pa'i don can nyid rnam par bcad pa na yang bden pa'i don can nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid rnam par bcad pa na yang bden pa'i don can nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even if the meaning of negation is excluded, the meaning of truth is not excluded.

original: phyir te gtan tshigs log pa na rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir te gtan tshigs log pa na rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because when the reason is negated, the pervasion is not implied.

original: ji ltar ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed kyi tshig bden pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pas rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa med pa de ltar na gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcad pa yin
analyzed: ji ltar ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed kyi tshig bden pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pas rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa med pa de ltar na gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcad pa yin
translated: is inconclusive in the sense that it does not entail that the living body is the self.

original: no // srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa @18a * //
analyzed: no // srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa @18a * //
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it possesses life, etc.‚Äù

original: nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ldog pa can 'di la yang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag bdag med pa ma yin pa ste /üîΩbdag med pa log pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ldog pa can 'di la yang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dag bdag med pa ma yin pa ste / bdag med pa log pa la yang ngo //
translated: is inconclusive in the sense that it does not entail that those who possess life, etc. are not without a self.

original: dngos po grub par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po grub par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The negation of the absence of a self is not established as a real thing.

original: bdag gi mthun pa'i phyogs su grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gi mthun pa'i phyogs su grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not established as a similar instance of the self.

original: rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not entail that the absence of a self is not a real thing.

original: de nyid sbyor ba bstan pa sngon du song ba can gyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid sbyor ba bstan pa sngon du song ba can gyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make that very point clear by teaching the application, he says, for example, etc.

original: gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: This living body is not without a self,

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses life, etc.

original: srog ni dbugs 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: srog ni dbugs 'byung ba'o //
translated: Life is the exhalation of breath.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes inhalation of breath, and so on.

original: sbyor ba 'di la bsgrub par bya ba ni gson po'i lus kyi bdag dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di la bsgrub par bya ba ni gson po'i lus kyi bdag dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: In this syllogism, the probandum is the living body‚Äôs possession of a self,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i bdag gnyi ga la grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i bdag gnyi ga la grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self, which is the similar instance, is not established for both parties.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma dpyad par bsgrub par bya ba bdag dang gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rim bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa nyid dang / srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag gis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig dpyod par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma dpyad par bsgrub par bya ba bdag dang gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rim bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa nyid dang / srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag gis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig dpyod par byed pa na'o //
translated: The pervasion is established by the method of agreement and difference, when one analyzes the mere nature of the pervasion of the probandum, which is the self, and the probans, which is the possession of life, etc., by the similar instances, which are the living bodies, and the absence of the pervasion of the probandum, which is the self, and the probans, which is the possession of life, etc., by the dissimilar instances, which are the nonliving bodies.

original: de byed pa na yang srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid la bdag med pa nyid mthong ba dang / de med na ste khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid med pa la khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la med par rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de byed pa na yang srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid la bdag med pa nyid mthong ba dang / de med na ste khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid med pa la khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la med par rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: When that is done, the absence of self is seen in the absence of life force and so on, and when that is absent, that is, when the absence of life force and so on, which is the pervader, is absent, it is logical that the pervaded, the absence of self, is also absent in that which possesses life force and so on.

original: bdag med pa bdag nyid med du zin kyang srog la sogs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa dag ni mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i bdag la grub pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa bdag nyid med du zin kyang srog la sogs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa dag ni mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i bdag la grub pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though the absence of self is not itself, the absence of self is not established as the property of the subject in relation to the self that is the similar class, even though life force and so on are asserted as the reason.

original: bdag med pa dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par bcad du zin kyang bdag gi mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin 'phangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par bcad du zin kyang bdag gi mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin 'phangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because even though the nature of the absence of self is eliminated, the nature that is the characteristic of the self is not eliminated.

original: de bas na log pa yin du zin kyang rjes su 'gro ba shugs kyis 'ong ba med pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ldog pa can nyid yin no @18b zhes rigs pa pa'i 'dod pa sgrub pa'i gzhung de tsam gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na log pa yin du zin kyang rjes su 'gro ba shugs kyis 'ong ba med pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ldog pa can nyid yin no @18b zhes rigs pa pa'i 'dod pa sgrub pa'i gzhung de tsam gyis bstan to //
translated: Therefore, even if it is reversed, because there is no implicit forward pervasion, the reason of life-force, etc. is reversed. This is taught by just that treatise that establishes the assertion of the logicians.

original: khas blangs pa de la da skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khas blangs pa de la da skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the fault in that assertion, he says:

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsrog la sogs pa dag las srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid log pas bdag med pa ldog par 'gyur bas kyang srog la sogs pa dag ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i bdag la grub par 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar gson
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / srog la sogs pa dag las srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid log pas bdag med pa ldog par 'gyur bas kyang srog la sogs pa dag ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i bdag la grub par 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar gson
translated: If, in that way, etc.üîΩSince the absence of life-force, etc. is reversed by the reversal of the absence of life-force, etc., life-force, etc. are not established as the self that is the similar class.

original: po'i lus bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa dag gis bdag med pa 'ba' zhig bsal bar 'gyur gyi bdag nye bar 'jog ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: po'i lus bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa dag gis bdag med pa 'ba' zhig bsal bar 'gyur gyi bdag nye bar 'jog ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In that way, in the proof of the body of the opponent, by the reason of life-force, etc., only the absence of the self is eliminated, but the self is not posited.

original: srung bar byed pa'i dag de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: srung bar byed pa'i dag de nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to eliminate that very protection, he says, ‚Äúbecause of the non-existence of self, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa de bsal ba ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa de bsal ba ste /
translated: Because of the non-existence of selflessness, etc., life, etc. are eliminated.

original: bdag med pa tsam rnam par gcod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag med pa tsam rnam par gcod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It is a mere exclusion of selflessness,

original: bdag nye bar 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nye bar 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the positing of a self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag dang bcas pa de la srog la sogs pa yod pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa de la srog la sogs pa yod pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of life, etc. is not established in that which possesses a self.

original: de ltar 'gyur na bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i bdag med pa nyid gson po'i lus las bsal ba na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur na bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i bdag med pa nyid gson po'i lus las bsal ba na /
translated: If that were the case, then when selflessness, which is incompatible with the possession of a self, is eliminated from the living body,

original: don gyis gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: the living body would become one that possesses a self.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe living body is not established as having a self by the negation of selflessness,‚Äù etc.

original: bdag med pa log pas kyang gson po'i lus la bdag grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa log pas kyang gson po'i lus la bdag grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The living body is not established as having a self by the negation of selflessness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong bar 'dod na yang mthun pa'i phyogs bdag la yang srog la sogs pa grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam pa gzhan du na bdag log tu zin kyang gal te srog la sogs pa bdag la rnam par gnas pa mi thob pa de'i tshe bdag med pa las ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong bar 'dod na yang mthun pa'i phyogs bdag la yang srog la sogs pa grub par thal bar 'gyur ro // rnam pa gzhan du na bdag log tu zin kyang gal te srog la sogs pa bdag la rnam par gnas pa mi thob pa de'i tshe bdag med pa las ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If you assert that life force and so on are reversed from selflessness, which is the opposite of the position, then it follows that life force and so on would be established in the self, which is the similar position.

original: / rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is otherwise, then even if the self is reversed, if life force and so on are not obtained as abiding in the self, then at that time they would not be reversed from selflessness because there is no other alternative.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pas de de bas na bzlog pa'i khyab pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pas de de bas na bzlog pa'i khyab pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since that is the case, the reverse pervasion does not exist.

original: bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa nyid dang srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi @19a * //
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa nyid dang srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa nyid dang srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi @19a * //
translated: The opposite of having a self and having life force and so on is selflessness and not having life force and so on.

original: khyab pa mi 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab pa mi 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the pervasion is not established.

original: gang gi tshe zhen bdag med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog pa ma grub na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhen bdag med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog pa ma grub na'o //
translated: When it is not established that life force and so on are absent in the absence of the self.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa dag las bdag med pa nyid log par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa dag las bdag med pa nyid log par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: If the absence of the self were to cease when life force and so on cease,

original: gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs srog la sogs ba dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa la khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs srog la sogs ba dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa la khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the absence of the self, which is the opposite of the reason, would pervade the opposite of the probandum.

original: ldog pa de byang rjes su 'gro ba yod na 'gyur ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ldog pa de byang rjes su 'gro ba yod na 'gyur ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If there were positive concomitance, then it would be so.

original: ldog pa de grub pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa de grub pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The establishment of the absence of the self is positive concomitance,

original: de ni de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de ni de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because it is the case that if the self does not exist, the absence of the self exists.

original: ldog pa grub pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba grub par bstan to //
analyzed: ldog pa grub pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba grub par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the establishment of the absence of the self is positive concomitance.

original: ci ste rjes su 'gro ba grub par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba ma grub na ni de ldog pa grub tu zin kyang bdag de ldog pa de bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste rjes su 'gro ba grub par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba ma grub na ni de ldog pa grub tu zin kyang bdag de ldog pa de bdag med pa'o //
translated: But if you do not accept the establishment of positive concomitance, then if there is no establishment of positive concomitance, then even if the absence of the self is established, the absence of the self is not established by the absence of the self.

original: de ni srog la sogs pa las bzlog pa grub tu zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ni srog la sogs pa las bzlog pa grub tu zin kyang ngo //
translated: Although the negation of life, etc. is established,

original: de ma grub pa ste bdag de'i mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba gson po'i lus la yang bdag med pa log tu zin kyang bdag mi 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma grub pa ste bdag de'i mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba gson po'i lus la yang bdag med pa log tu zin kyang bdag mi 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the non-establishment of that is because the establishment of the concordant side of that self is not established. Therefore, although the negation of self in the living body, which is the probandum, is established, it follows that the self is not established.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus, he concludes with Therefore, etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyab pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin zhing bral ba ma yin te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la khyab par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyab pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin zhing bral ba ma yin te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la khyab par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya
translated: Therefore, for that reason, the pervasion of the negation is not without the positive concomitance, nor is it devoid of the pervasion that is established in the probandum and the similar instances of the probans.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rigs pa pa'i srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis bdag med pa la khyab pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: rigs pa pa'i srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis bdag med pa la khyab pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is possible that the NaiyƒÅyikas would have the pervasion of selflessness by the non-possession of life, etc.

original: gson po'i lus la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir khas blangs nas kyang bden pa'i don can nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma byas pa nyid la rnam pa 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir khas blangs nas kyang bden pa'i don can nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma byas pa nyid la rnam pa 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no other aspect of the living body, even if you accept that, you still have not stated a reason that proves it has a real object.

original: log pa'i don can nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: The object of a mistaken consciousness is not established as having a real object.

original: log pa'i don can nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag ni skyes bus byas pa nyid kyis khyab par rgyur gyur pa'i sgras skyes bus ma byas pa las log tu zin kyang ma byas pa ni bden pa'i don can nyid du grub pa ma
analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag ni skyes bus byas pa nyid kyis khyab par rgyur gyur pa'i sgras skyes bus ma byas pa las log tu zin kyang ma byas pa ni bden pa'i don can nyid du grub pa ma
translated: The objects that are the opposite of the probandum are pervaded by being produced by a person. The sound that is the cause is not produced by a person. Even though it is the opposite of not being produced by a person, not being produced does not establish it as having a real object.

original: yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bden pa'i @19b don can dang log pa'i don ma gtogs par don med par can gyi rnam pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i @19b don can dang log pa'i don ma gtogs par don med par can gyi rnam pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from having a real object and having a false object, there is no other aspect of having an object.

original: gal te sgra rnams la bden pa'i don can nyid dang log pa'i don can nyid kyi phung po yod pa de'i tshe sgra rnams la phung po gnyis yod na de ltar 'gyur ba ste /

analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid de /

analyzed: gang gis ni 'di ltar 'di ni skyes bus brdar byas pa yin la /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ngag gi don gzhan ni skyes bus byas pa yin no zhes nges par dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ba @20b yin te /

analyzed: de gang zhe na tshad mas mi slu ste /

analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bus byas pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: skyes bus bstan pa la ltos pa la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi don dag chos mthun pa yod pa'o //

original: de bas na de ltar rigs mthun pa'i gsal ba'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar rigs mthun pa'i gsal ba'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because the differences of shape, etc., which are concomitant with the manifest entity of a similar type are perceived,üîΩit is acceptable to assert that the differences of shape, etc., are the causes of the perception of the differences of type, even though the differences of type, such as cow and horse, are not accepted.

original: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa la rigs tha dad pa 'dod kyang bla ste bram ze la sogs pa dag la rigs la sogs pa so sor nges pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa la rigs tha dad pa 'dod kyang bla ste bram ze la sogs pa dag la rigs la sogs pa so sor nges pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But if the differences of caste, etc., of the brahmin, etc., are not individually ascertained,

original: gang gis na rigs tha dad pa rtogs par byed /
analyzed: gang gis na rigs tha dad pa rtogs par byed /
translated: by what are the differences of type understood?

original: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa dag la cig car goms pa'i 'jig rten gyi yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pa yang bstan pa med par rigs kyi khyad par 'di ni ba lang yin la 'di ni rta yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi de
analyzed: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa dag la cig car goms pa'i 'jig rten gyi yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pa yang bstan pa med par rigs kyi khyad par 'di ni ba lang yin la 'di ni rta yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi de
translated: Even though the differences of place, time, etc., are not demonstrated simultaneously in the cow, horse, etc., the world, which is accustomed to them, understands the difference of type, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is a horse,‚Äù etc.,

original: ltar bram ze la sogs pa'i khyad par ma bstan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltar bram ze la sogs pa'i khyad par ma bstan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but it does not understand the differences of brahmin, etc., without being taught.

original: de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni ba lang dang rta dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni ba lang dang rta dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLike that‚Äù means like the cow and horse.

original: bram ze dang dmangs rigs 'di dag la rigs mthun pa'i gsal ba dag la yon tan rnam pa cung zhig kyang gnas pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bram ze dang dmangs rigs 'di dag la rigs mthun pa'i gsal ba dag la yon tan rnam pa cung zhig kyang gnas pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: We do not see the slightest quality residing in the castes of Brahmin and so on that is not also found in the castes of non-Brahmin and so on.

original: yon tan smos pa ni 'dir nye bar mtshon pa de ltar na rigs dang nus pa'i khyad par rnam par nges par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: yon tan smos pa ni 'dir nye bar mtshon pa de ltar na rigs dang nus pa'i khyad par rnam par nges par ma mthong ngo //
translated: The mention of quality is an illustration here. Thus, we do not see any definite distinction in caste or ability.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par ma mthong bar yang ji ltar dmangs rigs dang bram ze la sogs pa dag gi rigs kyi khyad par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par ma mthong bar yang ji ltar dmangs rigs dang bram ze la sogs pa dag gi rigs kyi khyad par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: And how can one understand the distinction of caste, such as Brahmin and non-Brahmin, without seeing a distinction in shape and so on?

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not so, is what it means.

original: de ltar na 'don par byed pa dang gtsang sbra spyod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'don par byed pa dang gtsang sbra spyod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Thus, all distinctions in recitation, purity, conduct, and so on are mistaken,

original: ser skya dang skra ser ba nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par brtags pa gang yin pa de bram ze la la yang med la dmangs rigs la la ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser skya dang skra ser ba nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par brtags pa gang yin pa de bram ze la la yang med la dmangs rigs la la ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the distinctions in form, such as being fair-skinned and having blond hair, that are imagined to exist in Brahmins are not found in some Brahmins and are found in some non-Brahmins.

original: gal te @25a * //
analyzed: gal te @25a * //
translated: If it is asked,

original: bram ze dang dmangs rigs dag la rigs kyi khyad par ni med na 'o na ji ltar bram ze la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa las tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bram ze dang dmangs rigs dag la rigs kyi khyad par ni med na 'o na ji ltar bram ze la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa las tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is no difference in caste among Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras, then how can the terms Brahmin and so on be heard as distinct?

original: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúDue to the difference in their activities.‚Äù

original: ming tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can bram ze la sogs pa'i ming can gyi khyad par gyi rgyu can 'di ni bram ze yin la 'di ni dmangs rigs yin no zhes rtogs pa'i khyad par gang yin pa 'di rigs kyi khyad par med du zin kyang
analyzed: ming tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can bram ze la sogs pa'i ming can gyi khyad par gyi rgyu can 'di ni bram ze yin la 'di ni dmangs rigs yin no zhes rtogs pa'i khyad par gang yin pa 'di rigs kyi khyad par med du zin kyang
translated: The difference in their activities is the cause for the difference in their names, such as Brahmin. The difference in their activities is the cause for the difference in their names, such as Brahmin. The difference in their names is the cause for the difference in their castes. The difference in their castes is the cause for the difference in their activities. The difference in their activities is the cause for the difference in their names. This is the way it is in the world.üîΩThis is the difference in their activities: They are Brahmins because they perform the activities of reciting mantras, performing fire offerings, and so on. They are Kshatriyas because they are devoted to the activities of ruling. They are Vaishyas because they are devoted to the activities of commerce. They are Shudras because they are devoted to the activities of serving the other three castes.

original: bya ba'i khyad par nan tan du byed pa ste /üîΩbzlas pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par nan tan du byed pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i bya ba nan tan du byed pa can gyi rigs las skyes pa'i phyir 'gyur ro //üîΩci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par nan tan du byed pa ste /üîΩbzlas pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par nan tan du byed pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bur gyur pa'i bya ba nan tan du byed pa can gyi rigs las skyes pa'i phyir 'gyur ro //üîΩci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: The difference in their activities is the cause for the difference in their names.

original: 'tsho byed dang tshong pa'i tha snyad la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'tsho byed dang tshong pa'i tha snyad la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: like the conventions of a physician and a merchant, etc.

original: dper na rigs mtshungs pa dmangs rigs dag bya ba'i khyad par de dang de dag nan tan du byed pa'i phyir dang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir 'tsho byed la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ba de tsam rigs kyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na rigs mtshungs pa dmangs rigs dag bya ba'i khyad par de dang de dag nan tan du byed pa'i phyir dang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir 'tsho byed la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ba de tsam rigs kyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, the conventions of a physician, etc. are applied to those of the same caste, the ≈õ≈´dra, because of their assiduous performance of this or that particular activity and because of their conformity. But that is not a difference of caste.

original: de dang 'dra bar bram ze dag la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar bram ze dag la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is the same for the brahmins.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir sngags 'di bram ze dang dmangs rigs la sogs pas khyad par med par sbyar bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir sngags 'di bram ze dang dmangs rigs la sogs pas khyad par med par sbyar bar gyur pa na /
translated: Therefore, since this mantra is applied without distinction to brahmins, ≈õ≈´dras, etc.,

original: bram ze la sogs pa de las khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin nyid sgrub par byed de //
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa de las khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin nyid sgrub par byed de //
translated: it proves that their nature is not different from that.

original: rgyu des na khyad par med pa kho na gdol pa la sogs pa dag la 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na khyad par med pa kho na gdol pa la sogs pa dag la 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: For that reason, the result is produced without distinction even for the untouchables, etc. This is the conclusion.

original: de bas na 'di ltar sngags rnams dngos po'i nus pas 'bras bu 'byin pa skyon yin te gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu'i brda las rig byed pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar sngags rnams dngos po'i nus pas 'bras bu 'byin pa skyon yin te gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i skyes bu'i brda las rig byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the fault is that mantras produce results by the power of real entities.

original: gzhan dag gi sngags de dag gi 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi sngags de dag gi 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one asserts that the result of those mantras is produced from the words of a person as explained above, or from the mantras of others,

original: khyad par med par 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ba de ltar na skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med par 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ba de ltar na skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then the result would be produced without distinction, and thus this fault would not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brda byed pa ste sngags byed pa'i 'dod pa las 'bras bu skye bar nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brda byed pa ste sngags byed pa'i 'dod pa las 'bras bu skye bar nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the result definitely arises from the desire of the one who makes the convention, that is, the one who creates the mantra.

original: bram ze'i tha snyad bstan pa de lta bu'i cho ga nan tan du byed pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu dang ldan par @25b so sor gnas pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brda byed pa de ltar mngon par 'dod pa las so //
analyzed: bram ze'i tha snyad bstan pa de lta bu'i cho ga nan tan du byed pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu dang ldan par @25b so sor gnas pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brda byed pa de ltar mngon par 'dod pa las so //
translated: The one who performs the ritual of the teaching of the Brahmanical convention definitely abides with the result, but not others. Thus, it is from the desire of the one who makes the convention that it is asserted in that way.

original: de ltar 'dod pa las 'bras bu nges pa la brgal zhing brtag pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa las 'bras bu nges pa la brgal zhing brtag pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the point of debating and investigating the certainty of the result from such a desire?

original: de lta na gang dag dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa can dag ste /
analyzed: de lta na gang dag dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa can dag ste /
translated: In that case, those things that exist by intrinsic nature

original: skyes bu bya ba la ltos pa med pa ni dngos po'i gnas skabs nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde dag ni de'i sgo nas te rang bzhin gyi sgo nas ji ltar rang bzhin gyi khyad par las 'gyur na 'di la yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes thal bar rigs pa yin gyis skyes bu 'dod pa can gyi dngos po dag ni thal bar 'gyur bar rigs
analyzed: skyes bu bya ba la ltos pa med pa ni dngos po'i gnas skabs nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de dag ni de'i sgo nas te rang bzhin gyi sgo nas ji ltar rang bzhin gyi khyad par las 'gyur na 'di la yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes thal bar rigs pa yin gyis skyes bu 'dod pa can gyi dngos po dag ni thal bar 'gyur bar rigs
translated: are the cause and effect of the very state of being of things, which are not dependent on the activity of a person.üîΩIf they were to be so, then just as they are in terms of intrinsic nature, why wouldn‚Äôt they be so in terms of the intrinsic nature of a person?

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: It is logical that this consequence would apply, but it is not logical that things that are desired by a person would be subject to such a consequence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu rang gi 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa de dag ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu rang gi 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa de dag ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those things that are done in accordance with the desires of a person are engaged in by some means.

original: gang yang khyad par can gyi sbyor ba pos sngags kyi 'bras bu thob bo zhes brjod pa de la yang ji ltar 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i don la rung ba'i sngags kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang khyad par can gyi sbyor ba pos sngags kyi 'bras bu thob bo zhes brjod pa de la yang ji ltar 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i don la rung ba'i sngags kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: Also, in regard to the statement that the result of mantra is obtained by a special practitioner, we see that the nature of mantra is suitable for the purpose of the person who desires it, and it generates that.

original: skyes pa'i phyi ma phyi ma'i khyad par skyed pa'i sgo nas rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyi ma phyi ma'i khyad par skyed pa'i sgo nas rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Or, it generates the special later and later states, and in that way the continuum is transformed.

original: rnam pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyor ba mthong ngo //üîΩskyed par byed pa dang yongs su 'gyur ba de gnyi ga ni khyad par skyed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyor ba mthong ngo // skyed par byed pa dang yongs su 'gyur ba de gnyi ga ni khyad par skyed pa ste /
translated: The transformation is characterized by becoming a different state.üîΩBoth the generation and the transformation generate a special state.

original: khyad par skyed pa yod na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par skyed pa yod na 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is the generation of a special state, there is transformation.

original: de lta ma yin na ste khyad par skyed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ste khyad par skyed pa ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so, that is, if it did not generate a special state,

original: sngags rnams khyad par byar med can yin na /
analyzed: sngags rnams khyad par byar med can yin na /
translated: mantra would not have a special effect.

original: sbyor ba pos ni ci zhig byed de mi byed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba pos ni ci zhig byed de mi byed do //
translated: What would the practitioner do? He would do nothing.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this in the lines beginning ‚ÄúBy what means?‚Äù

original: rgyu gang gis sngags kyi sbyor ba de yang sbyor ba po bram ze las 'bras bu thob kyi /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis sngags kyi sbyor ba de yang sbyor ba po bram ze las 'bras bu thob kyi /
translated: By what cause does that application of mantra bring about the result for the Brahmin who applies it,

original: dmangs rigs la sogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmangs rigs la sogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for others such as the Shudra?

original: sbyor ba ni sngags rnams skyed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngags mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sngags rnams skyed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sngags mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa /
translated: Application does not generate mantras, but rather, it is the non-manifestation of mantras.

original: gal te sbyor ba mngon gsal yin par 'dod na de ni gang du bsal zin to zhes bya ba spyi dpyod pa'i skabs su bsal zin to //üîΩrtag pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de rtag pa rnams 'ga' zhig kyang mngon par gsal ba ma yin no zhes spyi gsal @26a * //
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba mngon gsal yin par 'dod na de ni gang du bsal zin to zhes bya ba spyi dpyod pa'i skabs su bsal zin to // rtag pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de rtag pa rnams 'ga' zhig kyang mngon par gsal ba ma yin no zhes spyi gsal @26a * //
translated: If you assert that application is the manifestation, that has already been refuted in the context of the general analysis.

original: ba dpyod pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: ba dpyod pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: He explains with Permanents... and so on. It has already been explained in the context of the analysis of manifestation and generality that no permanent thing is manifested.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir sgra'i mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni sbyor ba por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir sgra'i mngon par gsal bar byed pa ni sbyor ba por 'gyur ro //
translated: By what cause does the application of the mantra become the manifester of the sound?

original: gzhan yang mngon par gsal ba yang bla ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par gsal ba yang bla ste /
translated: Moreover, let us suppose that there is manifestation.

original: de ni re zhig rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rung ba nyid skyed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gang las blo de gsal ba yin te /üîΩskyes bu sbyor ba po las sgra'i yul can gyi blo de gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: de ni re zhig rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rung ba nyid skyed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gang las blo de gsal ba yin te / skyes bu sbyor ba po las sgra'i yul can gyi blo de gsal ba yin na /
translated: It is not that the cause of the cognition is generated, because it is permanent.üîΩBut rather, the cognition is manifested from the person who is the agent of the mantra.

original: de ni 'bras la 'ang gal te sbyor //
analyzed: de ni 'bras la 'ang gal te sbyor //
translated: If the person is related to the result,

original: skyes bu sngags kyi 'bras bu la'o //
analyzed: skyes bu sngags kyi 'bras bu la'o //
translated: the person is related to the result of the mantra.

original: nyan pa po yi 'bras 'brel 'gyur //
analyzed: nyan pa po yi 'bras 'brel 'gyur //
translated: The hearer is related to the result.

original: sngags brjod ma thag pa 'di thos pa 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de yang sngags kyi 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur gyi smra ba po nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngags brjod ma thag pa 'di thos pa 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de yang sngags kyi 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur gyi smra ba po nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The one who merely hears the mantra immediately after it is uttered is related to the result of the mantra, but not the speaker.

original: de ltar na smra ba po gsal rgyu yin pa ste shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na smra ba po gsal rgyu yin pa ste shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the speaker is the cause of manifestation, the cause of cognition, and therefore is related to the result.

original: sngags kyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de yang nyan pa po la mtshungs pa de lta na yang smra ba po nyid yin pas na ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: sngags kyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de yang nyan pa po la mtshungs pa de lta na yang smra ba po nyid yin pas na ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: Although the cause of the cognition of sound is the same for the listener, why is the speaker alone endowed with the result?

original: sgra rtag pa ni rgyu gzhan las rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sgra rtag pa ni rgyu gzhan las rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Sound is permanent, since its nature does not change due to another cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo rnam pa gzhan nyid gsal ba ma yin pa dang sgribs par byed pa dang bral ba yang gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rnam pa gzhan nyid gsal ba ma yin pa dang sgribs par byed pa dang bral ba yang gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: Its nature is not manifested as another aspect, nor is it manifested as free from obscuration,

original: rtag pa'i sgrib par byed pa ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i sgrib par byed pa ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obscuration of the permanent is not produced.

original: 'on kyang sgra de'i yul can gyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra de'i yul can gyi shes pa ste /
translated: However, the cognition of that sound,

original: blo mngon par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: blo mngon par gsal ba yin no //
translated: the mind, is manifested.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra thos pa med par gsal bar brjod pa med pa'i phyir te sgra dmigs par ma gyur pa mngon par gsal ba zhes mi brjod do//
analyzed: sgra thos pa med par gsal bar brjod pa med pa'i phyir te sgra dmigs par ma gyur pa mngon par gsal ba zhes mi brjod do//
translated: Because without hearing sound, manifestation is not expressed. When sound is not perceived, it is not said to be manifested.

original: de ltar gnas pa de la gal te smra ba po sgra'i yul can gyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe smra ba po'i mtshan nyid sgra'i yul can gyi blo'i rgyu'i rang bzhin de ni nyan pa po yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa de la gal te smra ba po sgra'i yul can gyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe smra ba po'i mtshan nyid sgra'i yul can gyi blo'i rgyu'i rang bzhin de ni nyan pa po yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If the speaker were the cause of the cognition that has sound as its object, then the nature of the cause of the cognition that has sound as its object would also exist for the hearer.

original: nyan pa po de'i sngags kyi sbyor ba las byung ba can gyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yang 'chad pa po dang 'dra bar thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan pa po de'i sngags kyi sbyor ba las byung ba can gyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yang 'chad pa po dang 'dra bar thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the hearer would obtain the desired result, such as the explanation, from the application of the mantra, just as the speaker does.

original: de'i blo'i rgyu nyid de'i sgra'i blo'i rgyu nyid las 'chad pa po las gzhan du 'chad pa po de'i ngo bo gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bas na 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag gi sgra'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid las khyad par

translated: If that is so, then if the object field of the ear is the nature of sound alone, it follows that sound itself is the nature of sound.

original: sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúSound alone is the object field of the ear.‚Äù

original: sgra kho na rna ba'i spyod yul yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: sgra kho na rna ba'i spyod yul yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that sound alone is the object field of the ear.

original: sgra ni gdon mi za bar de'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: sgra ni gdon mi za bar de'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: We say that sound alone is its definition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la rna bas gzung bar bya ba nyid las ma gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rna bas gzung bar bya ba nyid las ma gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sound alone is the definition of the ear, apart from being apprehended by the ear.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid de la gal te skyes bu gang sbyor ba po gang 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i sgra'i bdag nyid can gyi sngags dag mngon par gsal ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe mngon
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid de la gal te skyes bu gang sbyor ba po gang 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i sgra'i bdag nyid can gyi sngags dag mngon par gsal ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe mngon
translated: If a person who is a speaker is the cause of the manifestation of the nature of the mantra that is the sound endowed with the result, then at that time, the sound that is the cause of the cognition apprehending the nature of the sound would not be heard.

original: par gsal ba ma yin pa thos pa'i yul can gyi ste /
analyzed: par gsal ba ma yin pa thos pa'i yul can gyi ste /
translated: The object of hearing that is not manifestedüîΩis not the object of hearing that is manifested.

original: byed pa gang dag gis mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa thos pa'i yul sgra la yod pa de zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: byed pa gang dag gis mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa thos pa'i yul sgra la yod pa de zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The object of hearing that is not manifested is not the object of hearing that is manifested.

original: sbyor ba po ste byed pa pos byed pa de rnams kyi mchu la sogs pa bskyed pa tsam gyis shub bu'i bzlas pa sngags kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin zhing yid kyi bzlas pa yang sngags kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba po ste byed pa pos byed pa de rnams kyi mchu la sogs pa bskyed pa tsam gyis shub bu'i bzlas pa sngags kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin zhing yid kyi bzlas pa yang sngags kyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere generation of the lips and so on by the person who is the speaker and the agent of those actions is not the result of the whispered recitation of the mantra, nor is the mental recitation the result of the mantra.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe zhes bya ba shub bu dang yid kyi bzlas pa nyid kyi dus su rna ba'i byed pas sgra zhes bya ba'i don cung zad kyang nges par byas shing gzung ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe zhes bya ba shub bu dang yid kyi bzlas pa nyid kyi dus su rna ba'i byed pas sgra zhes bya ba'i don cung zad kyang nges par byas shing gzung ba med do //
translated: Thus, at that time, at the time of the whispered and mental recitations, the function of the ear does not apprehend or ascertain even the slightest object called ‚Äúsound.‚Äù

original: yid kyi bzlas pa yang sngags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi bzlas pa yang sngags yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that mental recitation is the mantra,

original: sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúSound . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: yid kyi rnam par rtog pa sgra'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa yang sngags ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par rtog pa sgra'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa yang sngags ma yin te /
translated: Mental conceptuality that is not in the nature of sound is not the mantra.

original: de ni rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because you accept that it is apprehended by the ear faculty, that it is not produced by a person, and that it is permanent.

original: @28b rnam par rtog pa ni de las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @28b rnam par rtog pa ni de las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conceptualization is the opposite of that.

original: brgyud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: brgyud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe continuum . . .‚Äù and so on responds to the qualms of others.

original: gang yang shub bu dang / yid kyi bzlas pa'i dus su gal te blo de'i gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang shub bu dang / yid kyi bzlas pa'i dus su gal te blo de'i gsal ba yin te /
translated: If the clarity of the mind at the time of whispered and mental recitation is the mantra,üîΩthen the mantra would be impermanent.

original: sngags snang ba'i blo sgra de'i gsal ba ste shes pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: sngags snang ba'i blo sgra de'i gsal ba ste shes pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: If the appearance of the mantra in the mind is the clarity of that sound, it is consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brgyud pas de las skye ba nyid kyi phyir te sgra las skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyud pas de las skye ba nyid kyi phyir te sgra las skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from that indirectly, because it arises from sound.

original: de ltar na de'i sgra'i shes pa sngar skyes pa des legs par 'dus byas pa'i rim gyis yid kyi bzlas pa la sgra'i snang ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i sgra'i shes pa sngar skyes pa des legs par 'dus byas pa'i rim gyis yid kyi bzlas pa la sgra'i snang ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the previously arisen sound consciousness of that [mantra] is well-accumulated, and in due course, the appearance of sound arises in mental recitation.

original: yid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: yid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with If the mind... and so forth.

original: zlos pa pos yid kyis bsams su zin kyang sgra thos pa med cing sgra thos pa ma gtogs par sngags snang ba can gyi blo gang yin pa de ni med do //
analyzed: zlos pa pos yid kyis bsams su zin kyang sgra thos pa med cing sgra thos pa ma gtogs par sngags snang ba can gyi blo gang yin pa de ni med do //
translated: Even if the reciter thinks with the mind, without hearing the sound, there is no appearance of the mantra in the mind that is consciousness, except for hearing the sound.

original: de bas na sgra las 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na sgra las 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because it arises from sound,

original: sgra las skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra las skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is born from sound,

original: yid kyi bzlas pa'i dus su blo de yang sgra'i gsal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi bzlas pa'i dus su blo de yang sgra'i gsal ba nyid yin te /
translated: at the time of mental recitation, that mind is also the clarity of sound,

original: sgra'i shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: it is the consciousness of sound.

original: de bas na sngags kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir yid kyi bzlas pa la sogs pa de'i sbyor ba po 'bras bu bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sngags kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir yid kyi bzlas pa la sogs pa de'i sbyor ba po 'bras bu bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of being the nature of mantra, the result of the one who is engaged in mental recitation and so forth will be taught.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba brgyud pas sngags nyid yin na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba brgyud pas sngags nyid yin na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if mantra is by way of a continuum, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgra las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te sngags kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgra las don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni sgra la don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgra las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te sngags kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgra las don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni sgra la don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚Äúfrom sound,‚Äù and so on. The meaning conceptualization from the sound of the definition of mantra is the meaning conceptualization in sound.

original: de ltar na me la sv'a h'a zhes brjod pa na me 'bar zhing gsal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na me la sv'a h'a zhes brjod pa na me 'bar zhing gsal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when one says ‚Äúfire svƒÅhƒÅ,‚Äù there is the arising of some conceptualization, such as ‚Äúfire is the nature of blazing and shining.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang brgyud pas sgra la skye ba yod pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur te sngags kyi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang brgyud pas sgra la skye ba yod pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur te sngags kyi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since sound is produced, these concepts would also be like that, and would be the application of the definition of the manifestation of a mantra.

original: gal te don can yin te sgra gang la sgras rab tu phye ba'i don gyi yul gang yin pa de ni de'i don can yin zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te don can yin te sgra gang la sgras rab tu phye ba'i don gyi yul gang yin pa de ni de'i don can yin zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: If it has a meaning, then the meaning that is the domain of the object designated by a word is its meaning.

original: gal te blo de nyid sngags kyi gsal ba yin gyi sgra'i yul don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo de nyid sngags kyi gsal ba yin gyi sgra'i yul don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the mind itself is the manifestation of the mantra, but the concept of the object, the domain of sound, is not,

original: mi grub ces bya ba grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
analyzed: mi grub ces bya ba grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
translated: then it is not established, says the proponent of tenets.

original: sgra'i rnam par rtog @29a * //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam par rtog @29a * //
translated: The concept of sound

original: pa yang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa yang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: is not established as having the sound‚Äôs own characteristics as its object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro ste /
translated: Because it follows thought.

original: rigs mthun pa'i rnam par rtog ba rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i rnam par rtog ba rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a thought of a similar type is its cause.

original: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i yul can nyid yid kyi rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i yul can nyid yid kyi rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: The conceptual thought of the mind is the subject that has the form of superimposition.

original: sgra las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de sgra las 'byung ba can gyi blo thams cad ni de'i gsal ba ste /üîΩsgra'i gsal ba yin par mi smra mod kyi 'on kyang de'i yul can te /
analyzed: sgra las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de sgra las 'byung ba can gyi blo thams cad ni de'i gsal ba ste / sgra'i gsal ba yin par mi smra mod kyi 'on kyang de'i yul can te /
translated: He explains with ‚Äúfrom sound‚Äù and so on. All cognitions that arise from sound are its manifestation.üîΩHe does not say that they are the manifestation of sound, but rather that they are the subject of that, that is, the conceptual cognition that has sound as its object.

original: sgra'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni sgra de'i gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni sgra de'i gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: That is the manifestation of that sound.

original: de dang de ni bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang de ni bden pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not true.

original: gang gi phyir yid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni de'i yul can nyid de sgra'i yul can du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni de'i yul can nyid de sgra'i yul can du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the conceptual thought of the mind is the subject of that, it is not established as having sound as its object.

original: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'jug go zhes le'u gsum pa la ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'jug go zhes le'u gsum pa la ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is shown in the third chapter that conceptual thoughts do not engage with intrinsic characteristics.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don rnams rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rgyu ma yin na 'o na ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don rnams rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rgyu ma yin na 'o na ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If external objects are not the cause of conceptual thoughts, how do they arise?

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa med pa can te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa med pa can te /
translated: Those conceptual thoughts do not depend on external objects being present.

original: gang dag gi phyi rol gyi don thag nye ba la ltos pa med pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag gi phyi rol gyi don thag nye ba la ltos pa med pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that do not depend on external objects being present‚Äù is to be construed with the preceding phrase.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba gang gi bag chags sad pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba gang gi bag chags sad pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as they are‚Äù means that they are the cause of the activation of the latent impressions.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa nyid kyi nang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags sad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa nyid kyi nang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags sad pa ste /
translated: The activation of the latent impressions of internal conceptual thoughts is the basis of consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa snga ma snga mas bsgos pa'i nus pa sad pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa snga ma snga mas bsgos pa'i nus pa sad pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They arise from the activation of the potential that is infused by previous conceptual thoughts.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar don med par 'gyur ba de bas na de dag ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar don med par 'gyur ba de bas na de dag ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Since they would be without an object in this way, therefore they are not causes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'gags pa ni zhig pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'gags pa ni zhig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExternal‚Äù and so on. ‚ÄúCeased‚Äù means destroyed.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFuture‚Äù means not yet arisen.

original: phyi rol 'gags shing ma skyes su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol 'gags shing ma skyes su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though external objects are stopped and not produced, there are still conceptual thoughts.

original: gang gi phyir don med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir don gyi rgyu can dag ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir don gyi rgyu can dag ma yin no //
translated: Because they would be meaningless, they are not caused by objects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir gang yod pa de nyid nye ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang yod pa de nyid nye ba ste /
translated: Because if something exists, it is near.

original: yod pa'i khyad par la ltos pa med pa de ni ltos pa med pa de'i skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yod pa'i khyad par la ltos pa med pa de ni ltos pa med pa de'i skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing /
translated: If something does not depend on a particular existent, then it is not a cause that produces that which does not depend on it.

original: phyi rol gyi don rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yang ji ltar na yul yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yang ji ltar na yul yin te /
translated: If an external object is not the cause of a conceptual thought, how can it be its object?

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul yin par @29b 'gal ba'i phyir ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul yin par @29b 'gal ba'i phyir ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is contradictory for something that is not a cause to be an object.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na rnam par rtog pa ni sgra'i yul can ma yin pa de bas na yid kyi rnam par rtog pa yid kyi bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can sgra'i gsal ba nyid ma yin na gang las te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na rnam par rtog pa ni sgra'i yul can ma yin pa de bas na yid kyi rnam par rtog pa yid kyi bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can sgra'i gsal ba nyid ma yin na gang las te /
translated: Since conceptual thoughts do not have words as their objects, mental conceptual thoughts, which are characterized by mental recitation, etc., are not instances of verbal expression. How can they be the cause of verbal expression?

original: rgyu gang gis de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i yid kyi bzlas pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu sngags kyi sbyor ba por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i yid kyi bzlas pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu sngags kyi sbyor ba por 'gyur te /
translated: By what cause would one who possesses that, i.e., who possesses mental recitation, become a person who is a practitioner of mantra?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would not be possible.

original: de bas na de ltar sgra las byung ba can dang / de'i don can gyi blo sgra'i gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa de la yid kyi bzlas pa'i sgra'i mngon par gsal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon sngar bshad pa yang 'di la yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de las zhes
analyzed: de bas na de ltar sgra las byung ba can dang / de'i don can gyi blo sgra'i gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa de la yid kyi bzlas pa'i sgra'i mngon par gsal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon sngar bshad pa yang 'di la yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de las zhes
translated: Therefore, in this way, the idea that the cognition which arises from sound and has the meaning of that sound is the manifestation of sound is also faulty, just as the previously explained fault that mental recitation is not the manifestation of sound is also a fault in this case.

original: bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThat is also explained in the case of . . .

original: sgra de las 'byung ba'i sgra de'i yul can gyi blo sgra'i gsal ba yin zhing de'i rten te /
analyzed: sgra de las 'byung ba'i sgra de'i yul can gyi blo sgra'i gsal ba yin zhing de'i rten te /
translated: ‚Äù The cognition which arises from that sound and has that sound as its object is the manifestation of sound and that is the basis.

original: sgra'i gsal ba de'i rten skyes bu gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgra'i gsal ba de'i rten skyes bu gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la yang bshad zin to //
translated: That person who is the basis of that manifestation of sound is also explained in this case.

original: ci zhig bshad zin ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig bshad zin ce na /
translated: What was explained?

original: nyan pa po la yang sbyor ba po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyan pa po la yang sbyor ba po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and it would follow, absurdly, that the hearer would be the one who applies the mantra.

original: nyan pa po la yang sgra las byung ba de'i yul can gyi blo rang gi rgyud la 'gyur ba'i dang tshul can gyi rten yin pa de ltar na 'di yang sngags kyi 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan pa po la yang sgra las byung ba de'i yul can gyi blo rang gi rgyud la 'gyur ba'i dang tshul can gyi rten yin pa de ltar na 'di yang sngags kyi 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the hearer were the basis of the cognition that has as its object the sound that is the mantra, then he would also possess the result of the mantra.

original: gzhan yang sngags rtag pa dag ni phul du byung ba skyed pa la sbyor ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i yul can gyi shes pa la yin na de'i shes pa la ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngags rtag pa dag ni phul du byung ba skyed pa la sbyor ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i yul can gyi shes pa la yin na de'i shes pa la ste /
translated: Moreover, permanent mantras are not applied to the production of a special result, but rather to the cognition that has that as its object.

original: sgra'i yul can skyes bu la brten pa'i shes pa la sgra sbyor ba yin par khas len na yang skyes bu la sgra byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i yul can skyes bu la brten pa'i shes pa la sgra sbyor ba yin par khas len na yang skyes bu la sgra byed pa yin no //
translated: If you accept that the sound that is the mantra is applied to the cognition of a person that has sound as its object, then the person would be the agent of the sound.

original: de ltar re zhig 'chad pa po'i rgyud la gnas pa'i kun nas slong ba'i shes pa'i go rims las yi ge rnams go rims bzhin du skye ba 'bras bu nyid du bstan nas yi ge dag go rims bzhin du skye ba yang nyan pa po'i rgyud la gnas
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'chad pa po'i rgyud la gnas pa'i kun nas slong ba'i shes pa'i go rims las yi ge rnams go rims bzhin du skye ba 'bras bu nyid du bstan nas yi ge dag go rims bzhin du skye ba yang nyan pa po'i rgyud la gnas
translated: Thus, having taught that the order in which the letters arise is the result of the order in which the consciousnesses that motivate them exist in the mindstream of the expounder, he now explains that the order in which the letters arise is the result of the order in which the consciousnesses that motivate them exist in the mindstream of the listener.üîΩ

original: pa'i rang bzhin yul can gyi shes pa rnams kyi go rims bzhin du rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin yul can gyi shes pa rnams kyi go rims bzhin du rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught that the order of the arising of the letters is the result of the order of the motivating consciousness that exists in the continuum of the expounder, in order to teach that the order of the arising of the letters is also the cause of the order of the subjective consciousnesses that exist in the continuum of the listener,

original: de'i khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe latter is distinguished by the former,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: phyi ma gang la yi ge snga ma'i khyad par te bye brag yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The latter is so called because it is distinguished by, that is, differentiated from, the former letter.

original: de ni yi ge phyi ma'o //
analyzed: de ni yi ge phyi ma'o //

original: rna bas zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: rna bas zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //

original: nges par 'gyur ba ni gzung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba ni gzung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIs ascertained‚Äù means is apprehended.

original: yi ge snga ma snga ma yi ge phyi ma phyi ma'i dus su yod pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: yi ge snga ma snga ma yi ge phyi ma phyi ma'i dus su yod pa nyid ma yin na /
translated: If the former letter does not exist at the time of the latter letter,

original: ji ltar na de'i khyad par can yi ge phyi ma dag gzung bar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩshes pa des skyed shes pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i khyad par can yi ge phyi ma dag gzung bar 'gyur zhe na / shes pa des skyed shes pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How then could the subsequent letters, which are its special features, be apprehended?üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that produces it.‚Äù

original: rang gi yul can gyi shes pa gang la yi ge snga ma'i yul can gyi shes pa des bskyed pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩde skad du gang gi tshe yi ge sa la dmigs pa can gyi rna ba'i shes pa skye ba'i dus de nyid kyi tshe yi ge aa kun nas slong ba'i sems de nyid kyis yi ge aa skyed cing des yi ge aa dang yi ge sa la dmigs
analyzed: rang gi yul can gyi shes pa gang la yi ge snga ma'i yul can gyi shes pa des bskyed pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro // de skad du gang gi tshe yi ge sa la dmigs pa can gyi rna ba'i shes pa skye ba'i dus de nyid kyi tshe yi ge aa kun nas slong ba'i sems de nyid kyis yi ge aa skyed cing des yi ge aa dang yi ge sa la dmigs
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cognition that produces it‚Äù should be applied to ‚Äúthe cognition that has it as its object.‚Äù

original: pa can gyi shes pa dus mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa can gyi shes pa dus mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being said: when the auditory cognition that observes the letter sa arises, at that very time the mind that motivates the letter sa produces the letter a, and that [letter a] and the letter sa are observed by the cognition that arises simultaneously.

original: de la yi ge sa la dmigs @32a * //
analyzed: de la yi ge sa la dmigs @32a * //

original: pa can gyi rna ba'i rnam par shes pa lhan cig byed pa dang yi ge aas rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed pa na yi ge snga ma'i khyad par can rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de bas na de ltar lhan cig byed pa'i shes pa snga mas bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa can de zhes bya ba ni yi ge phyi ma'o //

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na thos pa mnyan pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na thos pa mnyan pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //

original: dal ba thos can zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yi ge dal ba ste /
analyzed: dal ba thos can zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yi ge dal ba ste /
translated: The one who hears slowly is the one who, when the letter is slow,

analyzed: sgra gang la rna ba'i rnam par shes pas dal bar thos pa yod pa de la skad ces bya ste /

original: gnas skabs gang la yi ge rnam par dbye ba des par gzung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la yi ge rnam par dbye ba des par gzung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: At what time is the analysis of the letters well-grasped? This is the meaning of the expression.

analyzed: shin tu myur bar brjod pa na yi ge rnam par dbye ba yongs su bcad pa med pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gang las go rims bzhin du dran pa skyed par byed /

original: de ltar na shin tu myur bar brjod pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu myur bar brjod pa na /

analyzed: khyod kyis ci zhig brjod ces brgal zhing brtag par 'gyur ro //

original: myur du brjod pa na yang yi ge dag go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba can yin mod kyi /
analyzed: myur du brjod pa na yang yi ge dag go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba can yin mod kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang yi ge rnam par dbye ba snga phyi gsal ba ma yin no //

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i yi ge ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i yi ge ci zhig byed ce na /

original: de dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la ;
analyzed: de dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la ;
translated: He says: ‚ÄúThey produce memory.‚Äù

original: de dran pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba yi ge snga ma dran pa la'o //
analyzed: de dran pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba yi ge snga ma dran pa la'o //

original: phyis ni bdag nyid la dran pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: phyis ni bdag nyid la dran pa byed pa ste /

original: bdag nyid de rang gi yul la brgyud pas dran pa skyed par byed cing blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid de rang gi yul la brgyud pas dran pa skyed par byed cing blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: des ni rang gi yul can gyi shes pa'i yi ge rnams go rims bzhin du rgyu nyid bstan to //

analyzed: de ltar te de skad du bstan pa'i rims pa bzhin du yi ge rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid de dag ces bya ba yi ge'i rten can te /
translated: In this way, the letters are in a causal relation, as has been explained. Those refers to the letters.

original: yi ge rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid de skyes bus sbyar ba nyid la 'jig rten go rims dag ni yin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid de skyes bus sbyar ba nyid la 'jig rten go rims dag ni yin zhes brjod do //

original: @32b yi ge rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid cig la ltos pa zhe na /
analyzed: @32b yi ge rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid cig la ltos pa zhe na /

analyzed: de ni de rgyu 'dzin sems kyi zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: rgyu dang 'dzin pa zhes ni zlas dbye ba'o //

analyzed: yi ge da dag gi rgyu dang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: des na sems kyi sgra dang khyad par gyi bsdu ba bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the term letters is a bahuvrihi compound that refers to the mind.

original: yi ge dag gi rgyu sems gang yin pa dang de dag dang 'brel pas yi ge rnams 'bras bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: yi ge dag gi rgyu sems gang yin pa dang de dag dang 'brel pas yi ge rnams 'bras bu nyid yin te /
translated: The mind that is the cause of the letters is the result of the letters because it is related to them,

original: sems kyis yi ge dag bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyis yi ge dag bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: yi ge 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dag ni de dag dang 'brel pas na yi ge rnams rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: yi ge 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dag ni de dag dang 'brel pas na yi ge rnams rgyu nyid yin te /
