analyzed: yi ge dag gis sems de dag yi ge 'dzin par skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro // sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chag par byed de dag gi rnam par rig byed gang la sems kyis kun nas slong ba ste /
translated: because the letters are generated by those minds that apprehend the letters.üîΩThe term by the mind is explained by the term that is motivated by the mind.

original: rgyu yod pa de la skad cis bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa de la skad cis bya'o //
translated: That which is the cause of the indicative form is called speech.

original: dag nyid rnam par rig byed yin te /
analyzed: dag nyid rnam par rig byed yin te /

original: gzhan shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: tha snyad la de'i dbye ba gsum ste /üîΩyi ge dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: tha snyad la de'i dbye ba gsum ste / yi ge dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The conventional is threefold:üîΩThe verse states, ‚Äúletters, words, and sentences.‚Äù

analyzed: yi ge dang tshig dang dag ces bya ba gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

analyzed: de la yi ge dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni yi ge dag yin no // yi ge bsdus pa ni tshig go ;

original: / tshig bsdus pa ni dag go //
analyzed: / tshig bsdus pa ni dag go //

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa las ra zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di la yi ge lnga yod de /

translated: In the phrase ‚Äúthis word ‚Äòra‚Äô,‚Äù there are five letters.

original: yi ge sa dang / de'i 'og tu yi ge aa dang / de nas yi ge ra dang / de nas yi ge aa dang de'i 'og tu tshig drag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge sa dang / de'i 'og tu yi ge aa dang / de nas yi ge ra dang / de nas yi ge aa dang de'i 'og tu tshig drag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The letter ‚Äúra‚Äù is the first, then the letter ‚Äúa,‚Äù then the letter ‚Äúra,‚Äù then the letter ‚Äúa,‚Äù and finally the word ‚Äústrong.‚Äù

original: yi ges kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rgyu'i sems gang yin pa'i sems de ma thag pa'i rkyen des de ma thag pa 'dzin pa dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ges kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rgyu'i sems gang yin pa'i sems de ma thag pa'i rkyen des de ma thag pa 'dzin pa dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the mind that is the cause that motivates the letters.

analyzed: yi ge aa kun nas slong ba'i sems de sems gang gis yi ge aa kun nas slong ba skye bar byed pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that motivates the letter A is generated by the mind that generates the motivation of the letter A.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rim pas yi ge ra dang tshig drag dang sems gang gis kun nas slong par byed pa de dag ni snga ma snga ma'i rkyen can te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rim pas yi ge ra dang tshig drag dang sems gang gis kun nas slong par byed pa de dag ni snga ma snga ma'i rkyen can te /

original: gang la sems snga ma snga ma'i rkyen te /
analyzed: gang la sems snga ma snga ma'i rkyen te /
translated: The mind that motivates the previous ones is the condition of the later ones.

original: rgyu yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩde la yi ge aa kun nas slong ba'i @33a * //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // de la yi ge aa kun nas slong ba'i @33a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat has a cause‚Äù is supplied.üîΩThe mind that motivates the letter A is the cause of the mind that motivates the letter Ra.

original: sems kyi yi ge ra kun nas slong ba'i sems rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi yi ge ra kun nas slong ba'i sems rdzogs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yi ge ra kun nas slong bar byed pa de ma thag pa'i sems kyi rkyen gyis yi ge aa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang yi ge aa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems kyis tshig drag skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i kun nas slong ba'i sems kyi dag gi don to //
translated: The letter ra is the condition of the immediately preceding mind that activates it, and the letter a is activated by the mind that activates it. The mind that activates the letter a activates the word.üîΩThe meaning of the word ‚Äúmind‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe mind that activates‚Äù is the immediately preceding mind.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir rgyu gzhan dang gzhan dag dang ldan pa'i yi ge dag ni zhes bya ba ni gang dag la kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems kyi rgyu gzhan dang gzhan yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir rgyu gzhan dang gzhan dag dang ldan pa'i yi ge dag ni zhes bya ba ni gang dag la kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems kyi rgyu gzhan dang gzhan yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: Therefore, because they have different causes, the letters are different from each other.

original: / des ni yi ge rnams rgyu tha dad pa la rag lus pa'i phyir phan tshun ngo po tha dad pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: / des ni yi ge rnams rgyu tha dad pa la rag lus pa'i phyir phan tshun ngo po tha dad pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: This explains that the letters are different from each other because they depend on different causes.

original: go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i tshul can nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i tshul can nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they occur in a certain order, he says, ‚Äútheir own causes,‚Äù etc.

original: rang gi rgyu ni kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyis rnam par shes pa dag go //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu ni kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyis rnam par shes pa dag go //

original: gang la de dag gi go rims de bkod pa de las skye ba yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de dag gi go rims de bkod pa de las skye ba yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that arise from those that are arranged in a certain order are said to be in that order.

original: rgyu'i go rims las yi ge rnams ni go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i dang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i go rims las yi ge rnams ni go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i dang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: The meaning is that the letters occur in the order in which their causes occur.

original: rgyu gzhan dang gzhan dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i rgyu snga ma snga ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dang gzhan dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i rgyu snga ma snga ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing other and other causes means possessing the previous causes of the letters.

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe yi ge aa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis yi ge aa skyed pa de'i tshe yi ge sa yang yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe yi ge aa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis yi ge aa skyed pa de'i tshe yi ge sa yang yin pa de bas na /
translated: Thus, when the letter a is produced by the immediately preceding condition of the mind that motivates it, at that time the letter sa also exists.

original: yi ge aa dang yi ge sa ni dus mtshungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yi ge aa dang yi ge sa ni dus mtshungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the letter a and the letter sa are simultaneous.

original: yi ge sa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems lhan cig byed pa'i 'gyur pas yi ge aa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge sa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems lhan cig byed pa'i 'gyur pas yi ge aa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the mind that motivates the letter sa does not produce the letter a by being its cooperative condition.

original: de bzhin du yi ge 'og ma dag la yang rigs pa'i de nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu gzhan dang gzhan ldan pa'i yi ge dag ces smra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge 'og ma dag la yang rigs pa'i de nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu gzhan dang gzhan ldan pa'i yi ge dag ces smra'o //
translated: In the same way, the other letters are said to be endowed with other causes, because they are the same in principle.

original: yi ge snga ma 'das su zin kyang yi ge phyi ma snyed par nus pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: yi ge snga ma 'das su zin kyang yi ge phyi ma snyed par nus pa yin pa de bas na /

analyzed: de mthong ba sngon du song ba nyid ni de mthong nas zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gzhan te phyis 'byung ba'i rdza mkhan la sogs pa byed pa bstan pa med par ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de dag kyang sgra dag dang mtshungs so //

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste byed pa po dran pa med pa'i phyir rigs byed kyi tshig skyes bus ma byas @37a * //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro // ci ste byed pa po dran pa med pa'i phyir rigs byed kyi tshig skyes bus ma byas @37a * //
translated: and such things as pots would not be made by a person.

original: pa nyid du 'dod na rtog pa de dag kyang bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang yod do //
analyzed: pa nyid du 'dod na rtog pa de dag kyang bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang yod do //

analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi byed pa po mi shes pa ste /

analyzed: dus shin tu mang pos chod pa'i yul la bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba de dag gi byed pa po mi shes pa'o //

analyzed: de bas na skyes bu'i bya ba'i rjes su byed pa mtshungs pa yin na /

analyzed: gal te sgra skyes bus ma byas pa yin pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i yi ge'i go rims 'di thams cad ni skyes bus byas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na / go rims byed tshul can skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gang gi thun mong ma @37b yin pa de nyid ce na /

original: shes pa dang mthu dag gis so //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthu dag gis so //

analyzed: mthu ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du don grub par nus pa'o //

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'chad de skyes bu tha mal pa gzhan gyis kyang yi ge'i go rims 'di ni dug bcom pa la sogs pa nus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin na zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par dbye bas

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshig le'ur byas pa las /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /

translated: By this meaning means that by this order of letters, one is able to accomplish the purpose of removing poison, etc. By this means by the order of the letters.

analyzed: go rims 'dis nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar rtags las shes par mi nus so //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: rdzas dug mthong du zin kyang mi shes pa'i phyir gsod pa'i nus pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te bstan pa las sngags dang sngags ma yin pa nges par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de'i tshe de med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes dgongs so //

analyzed: sngags nges pa med par @38b yang sngags nan tan du byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no mantra that is not effective.

original: de bas na skyes bu 'ga' zhig dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba sngags dang sngags ma yin pa'i bye brag rig pa yod do zhes de mi 'dod na yang dpyod pa pas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu 'ga' zhig dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba sngags dang sngags ma yin pa'i bye brag rig pa yod do zhes de mi 'dod na yang dpyod pa pas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if one does not accept that some person sees a transcendent object and knows the difference between mantra and non-mantra, the investigator should accept it.üîΩTo show that it is unreasonable to explain that mantras are effective by the power of their intrinsic reality, he says:üîΩThe order of the mantra is not the cause of the effect,üîΩbut the order of the mantra is the cause of the effect.üîΩThe order of the mantra is not the cause of the effect, but the order of the mantra is the cause of the effect.

original: sngags grub pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin gyi zhe sdang la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa sngags kyi cho ga nan tan du byed pa chos nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngags grub pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin gyi zhe sdang la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa sngags kyi cho ga nan tan du byed pa chos nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not the case that ‚Äúthose who are accomplished in mantra‚Äù are motivated by hatred and so on, and it is not the case that they are serious about the ritual of mantra that includes killing and so on.

original: de'i phyir las kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las kyi ngo bo gcig las kyang de dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las kyi ngo bo gcig las kyang de dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not logical that a single action . . .‚Äù

original: chos ma yin pa dang 'gal ba'i chos rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang 'gal ba'i chos rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that a single action, which has the character of violence and so on, should be both that and its opposite, that is, Dharma, which is the opposite of non-Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi cho ga rnam pa gzhan du nan tan du byas pa de nyid las kyang chos ma yin pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi cho ga rnam pa gzhan du nan tan du byas pa de nyid las kyang chos ma yin pa mi rigs te /
translated: Non-Dharma is the performance of the rite of mantra in a different way. Even from that, non-Dharma is not reasonable.

original: de nyid kyang mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: That itself is not manifest.

original: de skad du zhes dang la sogs pa'i bsam pa gang gis sngags kyi cho ga las gzhan du 'tshe ba la sogs pa chos ma yin pa bstan par 'gyur zhing bsam pa de nyid kyis sngags kyi chog ga nan tan du byed du zin kyang 'tshe ba la
analyzed: de skad du zhes dang la sogs pa'i bsam pa gang gis sngags kyi cho ga las gzhan du 'tshe ba la sogs pa chos ma yin pa bstan par 'gyur zhing bsam pa de nyid kyis sngags kyi chog ga nan tan du byed du zin kyang 'tshe ba la
translated: Thus, by whatever intention one would teach violence, etc., as non-Dharma in a rite of mantra, and by that very intention one would perform the rite of mantra, even if one performs violence, etc.,

original: sogs pa @40b byed pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de chos kyi yan lag tu gyur pa yin zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa @40b byed pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de chos kyi yan lag tu gyur pa yin zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: how could that be a part of Dharma?

original: gal te zhe sdang la sogs pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa sngags kyi cho ga bzhin du nan tan du byas su zin kyang chos ma yin pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te zhe sdang la sogs pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa sngags kyi cho ga bzhin du nan tan du byas su zin kyang chos ma yin pa nyid yin na /

original: da ni ji ltar chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa las chos kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i srog chags gsod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi brtul zhugs las so //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa las chos kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i srog chags gsod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi brtul zhugs las so //
translated: Now, how is it that one who desires the result of Dharma from a vow, etc., which has the nature of non-Dharma, as explained above, from a vow characterized by killing living beings, etc.?

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan dman pa mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can las so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan dman pa mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can las so //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to other inferior things characterized by impurity, etc.

original: chos kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa ni /
translated: One who desires the result of Dharma

original: longs spyod la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can te ji ltar thob cing bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: longs spyod la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can te ji ltar thob cing bstan par 'gyur /
translated: obtains and demonstrates the characteristics of wealth, etc.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
translated: The one who asserts the conclusion says ‚Äúresult‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa des ni chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa de'i rnam par smin pa ste las kyi 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa des ni chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa de'i rnam par smin pa ste las kyi 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
translated: The result desired by that one is not the maturation of that vow, etc., which has the nature of non-Dharma, i.e., the result of the action.

original: 'on kyang sngon byas pa'i dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon byas pa'i dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: However, it is the maturation of previously performed virtuous karma.

original: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bram ze gsod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bram ze gsod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says, ‚ÄúKilling a brahmin, etc.,‚Äù

original: bram ze gsod pa'i lung de nan tan du byas te /
analyzed: bram ze gsod pa'i lung de nan tan du byas te /
translated: and so on refers to the passage on killing a brahmin.

original: bsgrub ba la yul rnyed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgrub ba la yul rnyed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the acquisition of a country by one who is intent on accomplishing it.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gi skyes bu la la la bram ze gsod cing kho bos khyed la yul sbyin par bya'o zhes sbyar ba na /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gi skyes bu la la la bram ze gsod cing kho bos khyed la yul sbyin par bya'o zhes sbyar ba na /
translated: For example, suppose someone says to another person, ‚ÄúI will give you a country if you kill a brahmin.‚Äù

original: des de'i bsgo ba nan tan du byas pa las grong nyed pa de bram ze gsod pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des de'i bsgo ba nan tan du byas pa las grong nyed pa de bram ze gsod pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The result of killing a brahmin is not the acquisition of a country by one who is intent on accomplishing that command.

original: bram ze gsod pa'i spyod pas skyes bu mgu bar byas pa lhan cig byed pa rnyed pa sngon gyi dge ba'i las nyid kyi de ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa lta bu'i //
analyzed: bram ze gsod pa'i spyod pas skyes bu mgu bar byas pa lhan cig byed pa rnyed pa sngon gyi dge ba'i las nyid kyi de ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa lta bu'i //
translated: However, the result of killing a brahmin is like the result of the virtuous karma of a previous birth that is produced by the joint activity of the person who is pleased by the conduct of killing a brahmin.

original: 'o na chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs de'i 'bras bu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs de'i 'bras bu ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the result of that discipline which is not Dharma?

original: chos ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says, ‚ÄúThe result of that which is not Dharma,‚Äù and so on.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs de'i ma 'ongs pa'i ste ma 'ongs pa na skye ba can gyi 'bras bu dmyal ba la sogs pa mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi brtul zhugs de'i ma 'ongs pa'i ste ma 'ongs pa na skye ba can gyi 'bras bu dmyal ba la sogs pa mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The result of that future, i.e., future-born, is the undesirable hell realm, etc.

original: gal te 'di ltar dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa @41a * //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa @41a * //
translated: If one desires the result of virtuous karma,

original: yin na chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de la ltos pa de ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: yin na chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de la ltos pa de ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: what is the point of that reliance on the application of mantras, etc., which are of the nature of non-virtue?

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe result, etc.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa can gyis las de'i ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa can gyis las de'i ste /
translated: The result-seeker, i.e., the one who desires the result, of that karma,

original: las gang la 'bras bu 'dod pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: las gang la 'bras bu 'dod pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: i.e., of whatever karma there is a result, should be supplied to the phrase.

original: chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de yang ngo //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de yang ngo //
translated: That application of mantras, etc., of the dakinis, which is of the nature of non-virtue,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gzung ngo //
translated: and the application of killing, etc., are indicated by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir smin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is a ripening cause because it benefits in some way.

original: 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is a cause that produces a result.

original: ji ltar na dge ba la mi dge ba phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur zhen /üîΩphan 'dogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge ba la mi dge ba phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur zhen / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How can nonvirtue benefit virtue?üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúThe capacity to benefit is due to the variety of coemergent natures.‚Äù

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i phyir te ;
translated: The capacity to benefit is due to the variety of coemergent natures.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe dge ba'i mi dag ba dang / mi dge ba'i yang dge ba lhan cig byed pa yin pa ni sna tshogs pa'o //üîΩdper na dge ba shin tu rgya chen po byed pa dag gi dmyal ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can mi dge ba las dag dge ba'i lhan cig byed pa thob pas skye ba 'di nyid la nad la sogs pa tsam byin nas zad par
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe dge ba'i mi dag ba dang / mi dge ba'i yang dge ba lhan cig byed pa yin pa ni sna tshogs pa'o // dper na dge ba shin tu rgya chen po byed pa dag gi dmyal ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can mi dge ba las dag dge ba'i lhan cig byed pa thob pas skye ba 'di nyid la nad la sogs pa tsam byin nas zad par
translated: Sometimes nonvirtue is a coemergent cause of virtue, and virtue is a coemergent cause of nonvirtue.

original: 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a person performs a very extensive virtuous action, the nonvirtue that is the cause of a painful result, such as rebirth in hell, is obtained as a coemergent cause of virtue. In this life, the nonvirtue produces only a small result, such as an illness, and then it is exhausted.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa can gyi las kyi chos ma yin pa bdag nyid can gyi sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams 'ga' zhig gis phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa de la rnam pa gang gis phan 'dogs par byed pa ste /üîΩbstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa can gyi las kyi chos ma yin pa bdag nyid can gyi sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams 'ga' zhig gis phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa de la rnam pa gang gis phan 'dogs par byed pa ste / bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say that the rites of mantra and so on, which are not Dharma, are beneficial for those who desire results.

original: skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: skyes bu'i khyad par ni sngags rtsom pa po ste de nyid bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i khyad par ni sngags rtsom pa po ste de nyid bsten pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe special person‚Äù is the author of the mantra. He is the basis.

original: des rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bu 'byin pa ste gang la de nyid kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yod pa de ni skyes bu'i khyad par gyi rten gyi rnam par smin pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: des rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bu 'byin pa ste gang la de nyid kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yod pa de ni skyes bu'i khyad par gyi rten gyi rnam par smin pa'i chos can no //
translated: The one who has that as his nature is the one who has the special person as the basis for the ripening of results.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDharma‚Äù means a special merit.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'dod pa grub par byed ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'dod pa grub par byed ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the accomplishment of the desired result.

original: des zhes bya ba ni skyes bus so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni skyes bus so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the person.

original: byas pa ni skye ba snga mar ro //
analyzed: byas pa ni skye ba snga mar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDone‚Äù means in a previous life.

original: de ni de ltar mgu bar byas pas zhes bya ba la chos de ni @41b srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i spyod pas de ltar mgu bar byas pas te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar mgu bar byas pas zhes bya ba la chos de ni @41b srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i spyod pas de ltar mgu bar byas pas te /
translated: That is the one who is pleased by that, i.e., by the practice of killing, etc.

original: sngags rtsom pa po'i skyes bu mgu bar byas pas 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: sngags rtsom pa po'i skyes bu mgu bar byas pas 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no //
translated: The person who composes the mantra is pleased, and the result is produced.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩde'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir / de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says:üîΩThe result of that, i.e., the result of the desired action, is produced by the person who composes the mantra.

original: de'i 'bras bu can te 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can gyi las sngags rtsom pa po'i skyes bu des brjod pas srog gcod pa dang ldan pa'i brtul zhugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba po'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can te 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can gyi las sngags rtsom pa po'i skyes bu des brjod pas srog gcod pa dang ldan pa'i brtul zhugs la sogs pa'i sbyor ba po'o //
translated: The person who composes the mantra expresses the practice of killing, etc.

original: sbyor ba des phan 'dogs par byed pa ni las yongs su gso bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba des phan 'dogs par byed pa ni las yongs su gso bar byed pa'o //
translated: The practice of that is the healing of the action.

original: gang la de rnam par smin pa ste 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa de nyid kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yod pa de ni de lta bu'i chos can te /
analyzed: gang la de rnam par smin pa ste 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa de nyid kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yod pa de ni de lta bu'i chos can te /
translated: The one who has that as his result, i.e., the one who has the result of the action, is the one who has the nature of that Dharma.

original: byas pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir de mgu ba las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir de mgu ba las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no //
translated: Because it is a cause that is made, the result arises from pleasing that person.

original: gal te sngags rtsom pa po'i skyes bu med par yang des phan btags pa ste /
analyzed: gal te sngags rtsom pa po'i skyes bu med par yang des phan btags pa ste /
translated: Even if the person who composed the mantra does not exist, the mantra benefits.

original: sngags de 'ba' zhig bzlas pa la sogs pa'i bya ba sngags kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: sngags de 'ba' zhig bzlas pa la sogs pa'i bya ba sngags kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no //
translated: The result arises from the mantra's benefit, from the mere recitation of the mantra and so on.

original: de bas na skyes bu mgu bar byas pa las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa ma yin no zhes gzhan sems so //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu mgu bar byas pa las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa ma yin no zhes gzhan sems so //
translated: Therefore, the statement that the result arises from pleasing the person is not correct.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin no //
translated: The proponent of the tenets says No and so on.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says The person's... and so on.

original: skyes bu sngags rtsom pa po'i rnam pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu sngags rtsom pa po'i rnam pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The person who composed the mantra has aspects such as color and shape.

original: rang bzhin ni zhi ba dang drag po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni zhi ba dang drag po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nature refers to being peaceful, wrathful, and so on.

original: spyod pa ni lus dang ngag gi bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo 'gul lo //
analyzed: spyod pa ni lus dang ngag gi bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo 'gul lo //
translated: Action is the movement of body and speech, which is characterized by activity.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa de dag gi mos pa ni lhag par smos pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa de dag gi mos pa ni lhag par smos pa ste /
translated: Faith in the form, etc., of the mantra is the special faith.

original: de don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would be meaningless.

original: gal te sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa po'i skyes bu yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa po'i skyes bu yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the person who is the basis of the mantra's blessing does not exist,

original: ci'i phyir de'i rnam pa la sogs pa la lhag par mos par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de'i rnam pa la sogs pa la lhag par mos par 'gyur /
translated: why would one have special faith in his form, etc.?

original: sbyor ba ni skyes bu gang la phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i rnam pa la yang mos par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni skyes bu gang la phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i rnam pa la yang mos par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: One should not have faith in the form, etc., of a person who does not benefit oneself.

original: dper na dug la sogs pa'i las la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i lam po che pa'i skyes bu'i mos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dug la sogs pa'i las la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i lam po che pa'i skyes bu'i mos pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, one should not have faith in the form, etc., of a person on the highway who does not benefit one by the activity of, for example, poison.üîΩSpace

original: nam mkha' @42a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' @42a * //
translated: is not a person.

original: lding la sogs pa'i skyes bu nam mkha' lding gi sngags 'chang ba yang dug la sogs pa'i las la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lding la sogs pa'i skyes bu nam mkha' lding gi sngags 'chang ba yang dug la sogs pa'i las la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de ltar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: mos pa las 'bras bur gyur pa de bas na skyes bu phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa las 'bras bur gyur pa de bas na skyes bu phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: because the result arises from the man's conviction. Therefore, the man is the benefactor. This is the reversal.

original: gang dang gang skyes bu'i khyad par rnam pa dang rang bzhin dang spyod pa la mos pa las skye ba'i chos can de ni /
analyzed: gang dang gang skyes bu'i khyad par rnam pa dang rang bzhin dang spyod pa la mos pa las skye ba'i chos can de ni /
translated: Whatever is a phenomenon that arises from the conviction of a man's particular aspect, nature, and conduct,

original: rnam pa dang rang bzhin dang spyod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
